Name: Bulk create documents from the template
Meta Title: Bulk Create Documents from a Template
Meta Description: Don't spend time on preparing hundreds of documents manually, create only one template and prepare multiple documents onto it using excel.
Post Summary: Solution for simpler one-off bulk creation and filling the documents for signing.
Post Body:
Now you can use one template to automatically create multiple documents out of it. Furthermore, by importing data from Microsoft Excel, dynamic fields can be pre-filled for each document. This significantly reduces the time needed to create repetitive documents.

When analysing our customers' needs and how they use Agrello integrations with Zapier, we noticed that one of the most popular use cases is to connect Agrello with Excel or Google Spreadsheet to quickly create dozens of documents from the same template and pre-fill the data fields.

However, one concern our users had was that setting up a Zapier account and paying extra for it, didn’t make sense for one-off bulk creation of documents.

Taking this into account, we started to design a solution for simpler one-off bulk creation and filling the documents for signing.

‍

‍

When should you use bulk created documents?

‍

Bulk creation is handy when you have the same document template where a few parameters change for each signer.

Whether you need thousands of customers to accept updated terms or hundreds of employees to sign off on a new employee handbook, bulk creation provides a seamless solution for companies of any size. Common scenarios in which a bulk creation of documents for signing benefits your organisation include:

  • Updating the general terms of your service: Bulk creation helps when a sales team needs to get acceptance for the changes in general terms of service from all of their customers at once.
  • Sharing documents with employees: When a human resources department needs to quickly send out a new company benefits package or work-from-home policy, bulk creation provides an easy way to customise and send documents to multiple recipients at the same time, even if they differ from employee to employee.
  • Pre-agreed agreements with multiple investors: When your financial department raises funds from multiple investors and has pre-agreed consent for investment, they can use bulk creation to quickly send out loan terms to dozens of signers in one go.
  • Application forms from new signups: If you're launching a new training course, you may need to collect the data and get applications signed by all the participants. Bulk creation can be used to prepare personalised application forms for filling and signing with a single click of a button.

These are just a few examples of how bulk creation of documents and sending them out for signing can make your life easier.

‍

How to bulk create documents for signing in Agrello?

To better understand how you can bulk create documents from the template, let's go through an example where changes to the Employee Code of Conduct document are sent to employees for signature.

‍The process consists of three steps:

  1. Preparation of the document template and the Excel spreadsheet with the data.
  2. Creating a document template in Agrello
  3. Bulk creating the documents from the template

‍

Preparation

‍First, the template document must be prepared in Microsoft Word and the fields that are employee-specific can be marked as dynamic fields using {{curly_brackets}}.

‍

‍

Dynamically filled fields must be entered in Word with curly brackets, for example {{employee_name}}. To avoid errors, you mustn't use punctuation or spaces in the text enclosed in parentheses.

Next, we prepare an Excel file with a list of all employees and the data to be included in the document. A separate row must be created for each employee and a column for each dynamic field.

‍The table must contain the e-mail address of the employee to whom the invitation to sign should be sent.

‍

‍

‍

Creating a document template in Agrello

1. Upload document template

‍In Agrello you can easily create a document template. You need to select the "Template" option in the "Create New" menu and then simply upload the prepared Word file.

‍

‍

Anyone can create an Agrello account by themselves and for free. With a free account, you can create three documents per month. So, for automating larger quantities, a paid account is required.

‍

2. Placing signature fields

Once you have uploaded the document template, place the signature fields. In the document template preview add the signature fields to the correct place - scroll to the page where the signature should be and click on the “Signature field” button on the left pane. Place the field in to correct position and click on “Save field”.

‍

‍

Bulk creating documents from the template

Now you are ready to connect the Excel file and the Word template to create multiple documents for signing at once.

When you are still in the document template view click on the “Use template” button and choose “Bulk create documents”.

‍

‍

This will open a bulk creation wizard.

‍

Step 1. Upload Excel

Choose the Excel file with your employee records.

‍

‍

Note that our system allows importing 1000 rows from a single file.

‍

Step 2. Map the signature fields

In step 2 you need to define from which Excel column we will find the employee email.

‍

‍

Select the correct column and click Continue.

‍

Step 3. Fill in the data fields

In this step, you need to map available data fields in the template to the columns in Excel. This example only has one data field to be mapped - Employee name.

‍

‍

Click Continue to proceed.

‍

Step 4. Document naming and destination

In the final step, we define the dynamic name of each document and destination Space in Agrello. The dynamic document name is composed of the template name + one of the data columns. For example Employee Code of Conduct - Jarmo Tuisk.

‍

‍

Once that is done, click Submit.

Depending on the number of rows in Excel the document creation process can take from a few seconds up to a couple of minutes. So if you do not see the documents immediately, wait a bit and then refresh the space screen.

All the documents are created as Drafts and you can safely review them before sending them off to counterparties. Once sent, you can track the process and completion of your documents in your document space Progress view. You can also send reminders to any party or signee who has not taken the required action on a document.

‍

You can also view this video tutorial if it's more helpful.

‍

‍

We believe that bulk creation of documents will significantly reduce the time spent on creating repetitive documents in companies so that the emphasis can be put on what really matters - better relations, higher efficiency, and work-life satisfaction.

Let us know what you think about this feature.

‍

Post Body:
Whether you need thousands of customers to accept updated terms or hundreds of employees to sign off on a new employee handbook, bulk creation provides a seamless solution for companies of any size.

To better understand how you can bulk create documents from the template, let's go through an example where many employment contracts are generated to be sent for signing to prospective employees.

‍The process consists of three steps:

  1. Preparation of the document template and the Excel spreadsheet with the data.
  2. Creating a document template in Agrello
  3. Bulk creating the documents from the template

Preparation

‍First, the template document must be prepared in Microsoft Word and the fields that are employee-specific can be marked as dynamic fields using {{curly_brackets}}.

‍

Dynamically filled fields must be entered in Word with curly brackets, for example {{employee_name}}. To avoid errors, you mustn't use punctuation or spaces in the text enclosed in parentheses.

Next, we prepare an Excel file with a list of all employees and the data to be included in the document. A separate row must be created for each employee and a column for each dynamic field.

‍The table must contain the e-mail address of the employee to whom the invitation to sign should be sent.

Please note that the name of your Excel file should not contain any spaces.

​

​

‍

Creating a document template in Agrello

1. Upload document template

In Agrello you can easily create a document template. If you go into one of your workspace folders, you can see the documents/templates/permissions bar at the top. To create a template, go to the templates section and click the green "create template" button.

You will then be prompted to upload a file from your computer. Select your desired word or PDF file with the curly brackets marked, and upload it.

‍

2. Placing signature fields

Once you have uploaded the document template, place the signature fields. In the document template preview scroll to the page where the signature should be and click on the “Signature field” button on the left pane. Place the field in to correct position. It will autosave the position of the field.

‍

Bulk creating documents from the template

Now you are ready to connect the Excel file and the Word template to create multiple documents for signing at once.

When you are still in the document template view click on the “Use template” button and choose “Bulk create documents”.

‍

This will open a bulk creation wizard.

Step 1. Upload Excel

Choose the Excel file with your desired records.

Note that our system allows importing 1000 rows from a single file.

Step 2. Map the signature fields

Now you need to define from which Excel column the system will find the signers' email address.

Select the correct column or columns and click Continue.

‍

Step 3. Fill in the data fields

In this step, you need to map available data fields in the template to the columns in Excel. In this example there are multiple fields to map, and it is as easy as clicking on each drop down and selecting the correct corresponding column.

Here we can see what it looks like when we're done with the process

‍
Click Continue to proceed.

​

Step 4. Document naming and destination

In the final step, we define the dynamic name of each document. The dynamic document name is composed of the template name + one of the data columns. For example Employee Code of Conduct - Jarmo Tuisk. You can add a separate document name column to your bulk creation Excel file to determine the document name.

‍
To add a custom document name field, in your Excel spreadsheet, create a column named something like "document name", as seen in the example below

‍

Then, when configuring the name of your documents in the bulk create wizard, simply click your document name column like so

‍

Once that is done, click Create Documents.

Depending on the number of rows in Excel the document creation process can take from a few seconds up to a couple of minutes. So if you do not see the documents immediately, wait a bit and then refresh the folder screen.

‍

All the documents are created in the preparing for signing state, and you can safely review them before sending them off to counter-parties.

Once sent, you can track the process and completion of your documents in your document folder Progress view.

Lielākās kompānijās darba līgumi tiek pārskatīti vismaz reizi gadā kā rutīnas uzdevums. Dažām kompānijām jāievēro dažādi standarti un jānodrošina to ievērošana par katru cenu, tāpēc arī amata aprakstu atjaunināšana ir ļoti svarīga. Ļaujiet savam darbiniekam aizpildīt savus personas datus

Ja neesat pārliecināts, vai darbinieka personas dati gada laikā ir mainījušies - piemēram, vai viņi ir pārcēlušies vai apprecējušies. Paziņojumi nodrošina labāku pārskatu par visu procesu. Dokumenta īpašnieks saņem paziņojumu par katru parakstīšanu, un līguma progresu var redzēt darbvirsmas skatā. Name: Choosing Between Free and Paid E-Signature Tools: Which Way To Go?
Meta Title: Choosing Between Free and Paid E-Signature Tools: A Comparison
Meta Description: What to take into account when choosing Between Free and Paid E-Signature Tools: A Comparison
Keyword: esignature, esign tools, esigning, free esigning tools, free electronic signature tools
Post Summary: In today's fast-paced digital world, esignature tools have become indispensable for individuals and businesses alike, streamlining the process of securing legally-binding signatures on documents without the need for physical presence by being able to sign documents online. These tools not only save time and reduce paper waste but also enhance security and provide a level of convenience previously unattainable.
Post Body:
While free esigning services offer a basic entry point for users to dip their toes into the digital signature pool, paid esigning tools unlock a suite of additional functionalities that cater to more advanced needs.Such tools are often characterized by robust features tailored for business users, such as enhanced security protocols, comprehensive audit trails, and advanced integrations with other software systems. Individuals and organizations must weigh these expanded capabilities against the zero-cost appeal of free alternatives to determine the best fit for their requirements.

Why Use Esigning Tools?

As the digital transformation accelerates, esignature tools are swiftly shifting from a luxury to a necessity. Companies and individuals seeking to keep pace with the tech-forward landscape are increasingly harnessing these tools for numerous reasons beyond the simplicity of abandoning pen and paper.

Save money

To begin with, cost savings are a major incentive. Transitioning to e signature technology brings about a significant decrease in the expenses traditionally incurred through the use of tangible resources. This move is not merely a high-tech trend but an economically savvy decision, too. The ROI on esigning tools can often be seen within just a quarter of the year, as costs previously spent on ink, paper, and printer maintenance quickly diminish.

Save time

Moreover, the boost in efficiency and time management cannot be overstated. The automation of signature collection and document circulation results in a streamlined workflow. It allows tasks to be carried out with newfound speed, as geographical barriers dissolve; an executive in New York can add an esignature to a contract from a colleague in Tokyo within minutes, eradicating the cumbersome wait times and delays linked to courier services.

Reduce risks

Aside from operational tempo and fiscal prudence, esigning tools come with sterling security measures and legal compliance. Adopting an esigning tool means embracing strict encryption standards and protocols that protect against unauthorized access and alteration. This adherence to high-security benchmarks not only fortifies the integrity of sensitive documents but also ensures compliance with international legal mandates regarding digital transactions, offering peace of mind that each signed document is both authentic and legally binding.In this era of environmental consciousness, the positive environmental impact of esigning tools is a compelling aspect. By diminishing the reliance on paper, companies actively contribute to conserving forests and reducing waste, aligning their operations with sustainable and eco-friendly practices.

Sign from anywhere

Lastly, the contemporary workforce is increasingly mobile, with remote work being more norm than the exception. In this context, esigning tools serve as a cornerstone for enabling remote work, by allowing signatures to be secured from any location at any time, thereby maintaining business continuity irrespective of physical office constraints.By factoring in these extensive benefits, one can appreciate the comprehensive value proposition presented by e-signature tools, transcending basic digital convenience to touch on financial prudence, enhanced productivity, security rigour, ecological responsibility, and facilitation of remote work strategies.

Free Esigning Tools - What do you get for $0?

So, what do you get from free free e signature tools? Exploring the landscape of free esigning tools reveals a diverse array of options that cater to the basic needs of individuals and businesses taking their first step into digital document management. These platforms provide a solid foundation for users to experience the convenience of electronic signatures without an upfront investment. Let's delve into what some popular tools offer at no cost:

Adobe Acrobat Sign

Adobe Acrobat Sign is a reliable and free e-signing tool that offers essential signing features, making it an ideal choice for users seeking a straightforward and user-friendly design. With Adobe Acrobat Sign, users can easily sign documents electronically, ensuring a seamless and efficient signing process. Whether it's adding signatures, initials, or filling out forms, this trusted tool provides essential signing options that cater to various document signing needs.

Eversign

Eversign's free e-signing features offer a user-friendly and efficient solution for managing electronic signatures. The platform's intuitive interface allows users to easily upload and prepare documents for e-signing, while its comprehensive security measures ensure the authenticity and integrity of the signatures. Eversign's free plan also includes the ability to create reusable templates, track the status of documents, and integrate with popular cloud storage services, making it a versatile choice for individuals and small businesses looking to streamline their document signing processes without compromising on security or functionality.

Preview for Mac

‍

‍

The free document signer features in Preview for Mac offer a convenient and user-friendly solution for digitally signing documents. With the ability to add a signature, initials, or even create a digital certificate, Preview makes it easy to sign document and finalize important paperwork without the need for printing and scanning. The intuitive interface allows for precise placement of signatures and provides options to customize the appearance of your digital signature. Additionally, the seamless integration with the Mac ecosystem ensures a hassle-free experience, making Preview a valuable tool for anyone seeking a reliable e-signing tools at no extra cost.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, a surge in esignature software usage was observed as businesses sought ways to maintain operations remotely. Free esign tools played a pivotal role, integrating with business systems to offer essential features like authentication and mobile support. These functionalities enabled companies to continue their workflows without disruption, making the adoption of esignature technology a strategic move during challenging times.

The free versions of these tools provide a glimpse into the transformative power of digital signatures. While they are designed to meet the needs of users with limited requirements, they also serve as an introduction to more robust offerings that may be worth exploring as business needs evolve.

Paid Esigning Tools - What do you get extra?

Venturing into the realm of paid esigning tools, users unlock a treasure trove of advanced features and capabilities that go beyond the basics offered by free versions. These paid platforms are designed not only to simplify but also to enhance the entire document-signing experience with a focus on efficiency, customization, and integration.Here’s a glimpse into the additional functionalities you can expect from paid esigning tools:

Enhanced Security and Compliance

Paid services often include more robust security measures such as advanced encryption and secure storage, ensuring compliance with stringent industry regulations.

Customizable Branding

Users can personalize their document interfaces with their own branding, creating a cohesive and professional look across all correspondence.

Comprehensive Audit Trails

A detailed log of every action taken with a document, ensuring full traceability and increasing accountability in the signing process.

Integration options

Additionally, the integration capabilities of paid esigning tools are a significant upgrade. They seamlessly blend with an organization's existing software ecosystem — be it CRM, ERP, or any other management system. These tools optimize workflows by automating repetitive tasks and minimizing the time spent switching between platforms.To recap, while free esigning services offer a starting point, the expanded feature sets of paid tools cater to a broader range of business needs and workflows. Investing in such tools not only facilitates the signing process but also enhances document management, security, and the overall brand experience. It is an investment in efficiency, growth, and adaptability in an increasingly digital-centric world.

Evaluating the Best Paid eSigning Tools

In a head-to-head Comparative Analysis of free versus paid esigning tools, the distinction lies in the finer details and additional services that enhance user experience and security. For a profound understanding, let's weigh the offerings of various tools against each other:

Docusign

DocuSign's Personal plan, beginning at $15/month, and its $45/user/month Standard plan both allow unlimited document signing—this contrasts sharply with the basic free version, which is more restrictive. Paid tiers offer additional features like reminders, notifications, and multiple-user access, proving indispensable for businesses with higher volume needs.

Dropbox Sign

Dropbox Sign (formerly HelloSign) entices with a free 30-day trial. Subsequent to the trial, the Essentials plan at $20/month opens doors to an unlimited number of signature requests—ideal for those transitioning from casual to higher frequency document transactions.

Agrello

Agrello is an excellent choice for smaller teams, offering a range of functionalities including e-signing and contract management. Priced at €14.90 per person, it provides comparable features to higher-priced tools.

What are some other esign tools to consider?

For usage-based costing, ESignatures.io charges a negligible $0.99/document, allowing for granular control over expenditure—a fitting choice for those with fluctuating document handling volumes. Similarly, SignWell (formerly Docsketch) extends a teaser of its capabilities with a free plan for up to 3 documents per month, giving a taste of its utility before scaling with its paid plans, starting from $10/month.

Starkly, these paid services are contrasted with the simplicity of

  • Preview for Mac users and
  • Adobe Acrobat Reader DC for Windows users, which present no-cost options for signing documents sporadically.

Although they fulfill basic requirements, it is clear that the capacity and sophistication fall short when compared to paid versions.

What to consider when choosing Esigning tools?

When pondering the leap from free to paid esigning tools, your selection should pivot on several crucial considerations that align closely with your specific operational needs and long-term goals:

  • Firstly, assess your project goals and challenges. Determine what you are aiming to achieve with an esigning tool and the types of documents and transactions it needs to handle. Will it be used for occasional contracts, or for complex document flows that require advanced authorization and workflow management? Matching your project's scope with the features of the tool ensures that you do not pay for unnecessary functionalities or come up short on capabilities.
  • Secondly, consider the scalability and integration capabilities with your current tech stack. As your business evolves, so will your needs for document management and esignature processes. Does the esigning tool play well with your CRM, project management, or other essential software? Integration can be a game-changer in optimizing workflow efficiency.
  • Thirdly, factor in user experience, both from your team's and your clients' perspective. The best esigning tool should be user-friendly and require minimal training, meaning less disruption to your business during the transition. Free trials and demos provide a hands-on opportunity to evaluate tools and should be utilized to test their compatibility with user preferences and ease of implementation.
  • Lastly, budgetary constraints are invariably a consideration. Analyze the cost implications of the subscription models offered by esigning platforms. Take into account not just the initial outlay but also the potential return on investment. Look for options that offer free or low-cost plans that scale appropriately with usage and provide cost-saving opportunities such as payment plans or annual discounts.

By taking these factors into careful account, alongside ongoing learning and flexibility to adapt to industry changes, you can make a well-informed decision that serves your needs today and positions you for future growth. Such meticulous consideration ensures that the extra investment in a paid esignature tool garners more than just added features—it becomes a cornerstone in the edifice of a streamlined, efficient, and forward-looking digital strategy.

Conclusion

In the shifting sands of the digital age, the convenience and expediency of esigning tools have swiftly taken center stage, revolutionizing the way we affirm contracts and formalize agreements. The distinction between free and premium esigning services mirrors the evolution of businesses as they stride towards more streamlined, secure, and sophisticated document management systems.As we dissect their utility and potential, it becomes crystal clear that while free esigning tools throw open the door to digital convenience, it is the paid versions that usher in a new realm of possibilities.

With top-tier security measures, customizable branding, comprehensive audit trails, and powerful integrations, these tools are not merely an upgrade but a transformative force for any enterprise, emboldening productivity and fortifying trust in every digital handshake.Given their capacity to drive efficiency, ensure compliance, and facilitate a remote and mobile workforce, the appeal of paid esigning tools is palpable and persuasive.

They are not just a testament to the innovation of our times but a clarion call for businesses to embrace a future where agility and security take precedence.Now is the moment to grasp this digital transformation—to elevate the way you execute agreements, manage documents, and interact with business partners across the globe.

Consider the trajectory of your organization and the aspirations that propel you forward. Forge ahead by embracing the robust capabilities of paid esigning tools, an investment that promises not just a seamless transition but a vigorous thrust into a more dynamic and efficient future. Take the step: explore, experiment, and engage with a  esigning solution that aligns with your vision and scales with your ambitions.

Name: Collaborating with Your Team in Agrello
Meta Title: Collaborating with Your Team in Agrello

Keyword: Collaborating with Your Team in Agrello, Permission management, Access management
Post Summary: Are you struggling to keep your team aligned on document creation, management, and signing processes? Do you find yourself constantly chasing colleagues for updates on contract statuses or scrambling to find the latest version of a document?
Post Body:
If so, you're not alone. Many teams face challenges when it comes to efficient document collaboration and management.

This article will guide you through Agrello's powerful collaboration features, designed to streamline your team's workflow and boost productivity.

You'll learn how to:

  • Set up a centralized hub for all your team's contract activities
  • Efficiently manage document access and permissions
  • Leverage smart tools for contract expiry tracking and progress visualization
  • Implement best practices for seamless team collaboration

Whether you're looking to improve communication, enhance document security, or simply save time in your daily operations, mastering Agrello's collaboration features will transform the way your team works with documents. Let's dive in and explore how you can make the most of these tools to address your team's specific needs.

Understanding Workspaces and Folders

Workspaces: Your Team's Central Hub

A workspace in Agrello serves as the central location for your team's collaborative efforts. It brings together shared folders, contracts, document templates, and team members under one roof. Key benefits of workspaces include:

  • Creating a contract hub for your entire company with a single subscription
  • Allowing invited members to create and edit content without separate subscriptions
  • Providing a centralized location for all contract-related activities

Folders: Organized Document Management

Within a workspace, folders help you organize and share specific sets of documents and templates with the right team members. This ensures secure and efficient document management. Folders offer features such as:

  • Kanban-like progress overview for tracking document statuses.
  • List view of documents for easy scanning.
  • Shared templates for consistent document creation.
  • Access control features to share documents with right people.
  • Agrello Codriver - an AI assistant that helps you to track contract expiry dates, parties and more.

Setting Up Your Team in Agrello

Adding Team Members to Workspace

  1. Navigate to your workspace settings
  2. Click on "Team" tab
  3. Select "Add member"
  4. Enter the team member's email address.
  5. Choose the appropriate role (e.g., Member, Administrator).
  6. Send the invitation.

About Permissions and Workspace Roles

  • Members will have access to Folders where they are invited to and they will not see any other folder.
  • Administrators can see all the folders in the workspace and add new members to the folders.
  • Workspace owners have all the rights of the Administrators, but they can also manage subscriptions.

Sharing Access and Collaboration

Sharing Folders

  1. Access are managed on top-level folders only.
  2. Open the folder you want to share.
  3. Click on "Permissions" tab in the folder view.
  4. Click on “Add access permissions” button.
  5. Select team members you want to grant access.
  6. Choose the appropriate role for each member:‍
    1. Viewers can only view documents and add comments.‍
    2. Editors can create new documents and templates and send them out for signing.
  7. Save your settings and they become active immediately.

Best Practices for Team Collaboration in Agrello

  1. Organize strategically: Create a logical folder structure based on departments, projects, or document types for easy navigation.
  2. Utilize templates: Store and share commonly used document templates in folders to ensure consistency and efficiency across your team.
  3. Manage permissions carefully: Regularly review and update team member access levels to maintain document security.
  4. Leverage the Agrello Codriver: Use the AI assistant to stay ahead of contract renewals and expirations, extract parties and more.
  5. Encourage active collaboration: Train your team on effectively using shared folders, templates, and collaboration features.
  6. Use the Kanban view: Take advantage of the Kanban-like progress overview to track document statuses and identify any process bottlenecks.
  7. Use filters in list view: Quickly filter out the contracts by their statuses or by last update dates.

Conclusion

Agrello's robust collaboration features empower your team to work together efficiently on document creation, management, and e-signing processes. By leveraging workspaces, folders, and the various collaboration tools available, you can streamline your team's workflows, improve document oversight, and enhance overall productivity.

Remember that effective collaboration in Agrello relies on clear communication, well-defined processes, and regular use of the platform's features. As you and your team become more familiar with Agrello, you'll discover new ways to optimize your document management and e-signing workflows, leading to more efficient and effective team collaboration.

Name: Contract Catastrophes: Top Mistakes to Avoid in Your Contracts
Meta Title: Top Mistakes to Avoid in Your Contracts
Meta Description: Avoid costly mistakes in your contracts. Learn the top contract catastrophes to steer clear of in our blog post. Protect your business now.
Keyword: Contract management, contracts, contract lifecycle management, digital signing, mistakes
Post Summary: Contracts are an essential part of doing business. They help to establish expectations and obligations between parties, ensure that everyone is on the same page, and provide a legal framework for resolving disputes. However, as with any aspect of business, mistakes can happen. In this blog post, we'll take a look at some common mistakes related to contracts and offer some advice on how to avoid them.
Post Body:
Failing to read or understand the terms of the contract before signing

One of the biggest mistakes you can make with a contract is not reading it thoroughly before signing. It can be tempting to rush through the process, especially if you're excited about a new business opportunity or anxious to get a deal done. But failing to understand the terms of the contract can have serious consequences down the line. Take the time to read the contract carefully, and don't hesitate to ask questions if there's anything you don't understand.

It is always advisable to seek for legal advice before signing a contract, but in case a company is looking to save some money from legal costs or the contracts are standardised, then AI can be of help. On Agrello platform you can now ask anything about the specific contract from our AI-powered Codriver, who is your personal assistant, hired to help you make sense of even the most complex contracts.

Not defining the responsibilities clearly

Contracts should clearly define the responsibilities of each party. Not clearly defining responsibilities in a business contract can lead to a bunch of issues, including delays in product or service delivery, payment disputes, and even legal battles. When drafting a contract, it's essential to ensure that all parties understand their responsibilities and obligations. This can be achieved by clearly outlining the scope of work, delivery timelines, and payment terms. The contract should also specify what happens if either party fails to meet their responsibilities. By defining responsibilities, the parties involved in the business relationship can avoid misunderstandings, maintain trust, and ensure that the agreement is executed as intended. It's crucial to be as specific and measurable as possible in defining responsibilities, as this will help ensure that the contract is enforceable and can hold up in court, should any issues arise.

Copying contracts from previous agreements without review

Often times a generic pre-defined template will be sufficient to enter into an agreement without consulting a lawyer, but the contract still needs to be filled in with attention to detail. A common mistake in this case is copying contracts from previous agreements without carefully reviewing them to the specific business relationship at hand. Sometimes confidential information about a previous business relationship can be left into the contract text which is not meant for the eyes of your next business partner. Situations like these can lead to ambiguity, misunderstandings, and potentially costly legal disputes.

By using a contract management platform like Agrello, you can make the creation of standard agreements more convenient. On Agrello it’s convenient to create standard agreements from templates that you have prepared and uploaded. This way you can be sure that a template is always clear from unwanted data and it can be entered onto a fresh contract. It’s also possible to bulk create multiple contracts at once, if there is the need to prepare many documents for signing.

Not keeping track of contract expiration dates or renewal terms

Contracts typically have an expiration date or a specific term. In the case of businesses, not keeping track of contract expiration dates can have severe consequences. Failure to renew contracts with important vendors, suppliers, or clients can result in supply chain disruptions or lost business opportunities. It can also result in costly legal battles if one party fails to uphold their contractual obligations due to a missed deadline or misunderstanding of renewal terms.

To avoid these issues, it is important to keep track of contract expiration dates and renewal terms. This can be done manually by setting reminders or using a calendar, or through the use of contract management software that can automate the process, such as Agrello. Use Agrello reminders on our platform to stay on top of your contract deadlines and terms and ensure that you are getting the best possible terms and avoiding costly mistakes.

Not organising your contracts effectively

Reminders are a great feature to keep you on track with expiring contracts, but keeping everyone on the same page and organising your contracts is also key to navigate through contract lifecycle smoothly. It is still too common, that important documents get lost in the bottom of someone’s mailbox or personal computer folder. Considering that, it’s best to store documents in a single environment, where everyone can have access to the necessary documents. Managing access rights to the documents needs to be simple and controllable. We have written a longer piece on how Agrello can help streamline contract collaboration for larger teams here.

In conclusion, contracts are an important aspect of doing business, but mistakes can happen. By taking the time to read contracts thoroughly, clearly defining all responsibilities, using technology to automate contract creation, keeping track of expiration dates and renewal terms and organising your contracts effectively you can avoid some common mistakes related to contract management. Remember that a little bit of extra effort upfront can save you a lot of time and headaches down the line.

Name: Contract collaboration for teams
Meta Title: Contract Collaboration for Teams
Meta Description: Agrello introduces a new way for teams to collaborate on contracts quickly and securely.
Keyword: Agrello, Teams, Collaborate, Contracts, Securely, Edit, Sign
Post Summary: Agrello's most important collaboration feature is called team spaces, which practically means a digital workspace where your team can work together on documents and contracts.
Post Body:
Effective collaboration between all stakeholders is key to a smooth contracting process. In any company, there are usually several employees involved with contracts and therefore a contract management tool is expected to provide convenient ways of collaboration. Agrello's most important collaboration feature is called team spaces, which practically means a digital workspace where your team can work together on documents and contracts. With the latest update team spaces now include shared space templates.

Read more about the updates and how your team can benefit from them in this article.

‍

‍

A convenient team workspace

The most time-consuming part before signing a contract is the preparation. That's why it's important to make sure your team is on the same page. By inviting all colleagues involved in contract preparation to your Agrello team space, you can ensure that everyone has access to shared templates and an overview of relevant contracts.

A space member can be an editor who can upload templates, use them to create contracts, and send them for signing. Spaces can also have members with viewer rights - these can be your business partners or team members who do not need to prepare contracts, but need to have an overview. Agrello's team spaces are designed to help you organise all your important documents.

Therefore, there are no limits to the number of spaces you can create, and you can decide on what basis you want to sort the documents or who you want to invite to collaborate. Typically, documents are sorted by topic or project, e.g. employment related documents or NDAs belong to one space.

‍

Shared contract templates for your team

Earlier this year we introduced Agrello templates, meaning that you can transform your most commonly used contract templates into reusable and fillable templates by uploading them to Agrello. This feature has been very well received, because it's a convenient way to avoid mistakes and save a lot of time from contract creation. Since collaboration is key, the latest Agrello update brings templates under team spaces and we refer to them as space templates.

One or more members of your team space can prepare and upload templates to the space. Afterwards every member of the space with editor rights can use that template to create new contracts. For example, the templates can be prepared by your team's lawyer or legal assistant, and later the sales team can proceed with contract creation without getting further help from a lawyer, thus saving time for everyone.

From time-to-time many contracts may have to be renewed at once. For this use-case Agrello has a bulk creation functionality, which enables the creation of multiple documents at once onto the same template. Now that spaces templates are live, it’s also possible to execute bulk creation under a team space.

Having a designated place to store important templates and the ability to instantly create contracts from them saves a lot of time, as it’s no longer necessary to look through different folders to find the right contract template. The bigger the company, the more employees tend to change and rotate. Storing everything on Agrello team space helps to protect your team from losing certain contracts or spending too much time on training new employees and thus making the contract signing process slower.

‍

‍

‍

Overview of contracts

It’s important to get contracts signed on time, thus seeing the contracts by their signing status gives the whole team an overview of which contracts are already signed and which need a little nudge.

Agrello has a comprehensive dashboard view in your personal "My Documents" view as well as in the team space view, where all documents can be sorted by status into three tabs and you can track their movement from one tab to another. In addition to the tabs, you can also sort the documents as a list, with the most recent documents at the top of the list and you can also see the creation date and participants.

‍

‍

Bring your contract management to another level with Agrello team spaces and space templates.
Author: paula-sepp

Name: Contract Management Risks: Overcoming Obstacles and Fostering Successful Business Relationships
Meta Title: Overcoming Contract Management Risks
Meta Description: Read about the possible obstacles related to contract management and how to overcome them.
Keyword: contract management risks, contract management, contract templates, compliance,
Post Summary: Contracts serve as the foundation for business relationships, encompassing more than just the agreement itself. From negotiation to maintenance, contract management ensures the vitality of these connections. Yet, risks can cast shadows if left unaddressed. By embracing comprehensive contract administration, businesses protect their interests and nurture enduring partnerships.
Post Body:
Contracts serve as the foundation for business relationships, encompassing more than just the agreement itself. From negotiation to maintenance, contract management ensures the vitality of these connections. Yet, risks can cast shadows if left unaddressed. By embracing comprehensive contract administration, businesses protect their interests and nurture enduring partnerships.

Common Contract Management Risks

Based on our observations, there are several common contract management risks that businesses should be mindful of.

Incomplete or inaccurate contracts‍

The most common risk of contract management is the creation of incomplete or inaccurate contracts. Contracts that are missing key terms or have conflicting language can lead to disputes and legal issues down the line.

Non-compliance with regulations‍

Non-compliance can have significant consequences. If a contract violates applicable laws, it becomes null and void, losing its enforceability. Parties involved will no longer have legal rights or obligations under its terms. Ensuring full compliance with the law is crucial to maintain validity and protect all parties' interests.

‍Poor communication‍

Effective communication is critical throughout the contract management process. Poor communication can lead to misunderstandings, delays, and other issues that can negatively impact the contract.

Inadequate monitoring and enforcement

Even after a contract has been signed, it’s important to monitor and enforce compliance with the terms of the agreement. Failure to do so can result in breaches of contract and other issues.

‍

How to Mitigate Contract Management Risks

To address these risks, it is recommended that businesses implement effective contract management strategies to minimize these potential pitfalls. This includes:

Standardizing contract templates

To enhance efficiency and reduce errors, it is recommended for businesses to implement standardized contract templates. These templates serve as valuable tools, aiding in the swift and accurate creation of contracts. By adopting such templates, organizations can expedite the process, avoid mistakes, and mitigate potential risks.

Ensuring compliance

Compliance stands as a vital cornerstone. To navigate the contract management process effectively and economically, businesses are advised to prioritize thorough research and consult their legal experts. By taking proactive measures to understand and adhere to the relevant laws and regulations, organizations can safeguard themselves from potential pitfalls while promoting a culture of responsible and lawful contract management.

Effective communication‍

Clear and effective communication is critical throughout the contract management process. This includes regular communication with all parties involved in the contract.

Monitoring and enforcement

For effective monitoring and enforcement of contract compliance, businesses are encouraged to develop their own streamlined processes. By customizing their approach and leveraging appropriate technologies, organizations can effectively monitor contract performance, ensure compliance, and minimize potential risks in a seamless and efficient manner. Many companies have found contract lifecycle management tools like Agrello beneficial in supporting this process.

‍

Conclusion

In conclusion, it is essential for businesses to recognize the potential ramifications of overlooking contract management risks. The consequences can be far-reaching, including lost business opportunities and damaging PR issues. However, the solution to mitigating these risks is simpler than it may seem. By embracing a streamlined contract lifecycle management approach, businesses can effectively navigate these challenges. Don't let contract management complexities hold you back. Reach out to us to discover how our simplified contract management solution can benefit your business.

Harry Käsk
harry@agrello.io

Name: Create fillable Word contracts and request signatures
Meta Title: Create Fillable Word Contracts and Request Signatures
Meta Description: Learn how to create fillable word contracts and request electronic signatures with Agrello. Quickly prepare contracts for signing.
Keyword: Contracts, Agrello, Signatures, Documents, Legally-Binding
Post Summary: Fill & Sign for Microsoft Word allows you to create the fillable documents and request signatures using simple tags inside your Word document.
Post Body:
Some time ago we interviewed a number of people who work with documents on a daily basis.


Actually, we wanted to know what tools people use in the office, how they prepare their documents and contracts for signing, and how much time it all takes.

‍

What we found out is that the tool of choice is Microsoft Word. But it's no big surprise that in the 21st century, there's still so much manual work, so much paper, and so much time spent on nonsense. Especially when there is a single document template, but so many different blank spaces that need to be filled with different data, manually. This means you have to create duplicate documents and edit them all for multiple parties to sign.

‍

‍

Even if we talk about signing digital documents electronically, without the good old ritual of printing, signing, and scanning, even then preparing documents and contracts for signing takes so much time.

We know that electronic signatures are supposed to simplify the process of signing, right. In fact, it seems that it's not the electronic signing itself that takes so much time, but the preparation of the documents themselves.

How documents are prepared today?


Anyone who has ever prepared a contract will probably proceed as follows. First, you create a draft of the document in Microsoft Word and then leave all those blank spaces as fields to be filled in by someone else who will sign the document. Sound familiar?

‍
What else? You can also use a PDF-based editor to create blank fields to be signed. Or you can drag and drop these blank fields into place. And finally, you send the documents to be signed, usually by email, or share them via a cloud-based service.

This is a common practice, always has been, and likely will be in the future. But imagine that there are dozens or hundreds of such documents that need to be prepared. You have to fill in all these fields one by one and make sure that these fields are filled in correctly and properly. Sending drafts back and forth until a final version of a contract is reached.

Room for improvement? Definitely!

‍

How does Agrello simplify document preparation for signing?

‍
So what have we decided to do to solve this document creation process? First of all, it's still Microsoft Word, your favourite tool for working with your documents and contracts. The rest is about as simple as it gets. We call this new feature "Fill & Sign".

Agrello’s “Fill & Sign” for Microsoft Word lets you create fillable documents and request electronic signatures with automatic form generation and management of the signing process. Simply put, you prepare a document or contract in Word and use {{curly brackets}} for the empty fields that need to be filled in. But instead of filling them all in manually, you upload the document to Agrello, the fields are filled in, and the document is ready to sign.

‍

What sets Agrello's solution apart from other products for filling out and signing electronic documents is that you do not have to drag the fields into an additional tool or editor. Everything can be prepared in Microsoft Word, the tool that most people in the world use when it comes to documents and contracts.
‍

Why and when should you use it?

First of all, most of us know how to use Microsoft Word. So why invent a separate editor to create a document template where you fill in the blanks or drag and drop fields? People love Microsoft Word, it's a very flexible and powerful text editor, so let us leave it at that. All the formatting in your Word document is preserved and it does not matter how long the text you type is.
‍

For example, if you need to manually prepare more than 20 documents or contracts every month, Agrello can easily save you 10-20 hours of work preparing them. And compared to PDF-based solutions, Agrello allows you to prepare those documents 25-50% faster, depending on how many fields you need to add to the contract.

‍

Agrello's “Fill & Sign” feature saves a lot of time on documents and contracts where the parties only need to fill in a few fields to complete the agreement. What kind of agreements is the feature good for?

‍

Good examples are:

  • NDAs
  • Simple sales agreements
  • Terms and conditions
  • Application forms

‍

In conclusion

‍

Agrello "Fill & Sign" for Microsoft Word allows you to create fillable documents and request signatures, automatically recognizing fields and managing the signing process. The simple field markup language gives you the flexibility to define fields directly in Word. Drag your Word document to Agrello, assign signers, and you are done.

Sounds interesting?

‍‍

‍

 
  Give it a try and let us know what you think! To get started just log in to Agrello and upload a new document with variables. Be sure to follow these support pages, which will give you a detailed overview of how to work with the feature and save you some time.

Name: Sending and Signing Documents in Agrello
Meta Title: Sending and Signing Documents in Agrello
Meta Description: Sending and Signing Documents in Agrello
Keyword: Sending and Signing Documents in Agrello
Post Summary: Whether you're new to digital signatures or looking to streamline your processes, this guide will walk you through sending documents for signature, signing documents yourself, and provide tips for efficient document preparation and management.
Post Body:
Sending Documents for Signature

Follow these steps to send a document for signature:

  1. Log in to your Agrello account and navigate to the folder containing your document.
  2. Select the document you want to send for signature or upload a new one.
  3. Click "Prepare for signing" to start the process.
  4. Choose the output format:
    • PDF (most common, viewable by any PDF reader)
    • ASIC container (allows digital signing of multiple file types)
  5. Add signers by entering their email addresses in the top-left text field.
  6. Add signature fields:
    • For PDF documents: Drag signature field boxes to desired locations on the document.
    • For ASIC containers: Simply add signer emails; no need to define signature fields.
  7. Click the green "Send for signing" button.
  8. Add a custom note to the email invite (optional).
  9. Review and send the document to all added parties.'

More resources

  • ‍Read more about different e-signature formats (ASIC vs PDF)
  • E-signing guide

Signing Documents

When you receive a document to sign, follow these steps:

  1. Open the email invitation from Agrello.
  2. Click the link in the email to access the document.
  3. Review the document carefully before signing.
  4. Click on the Sign button on upper right corner.
  5. Choose your signing method and confirm your signature:
    • Choose the e-signature type (Agrello, Mobile-ID, Smart-ID etc)
    • Type your name or draw our signature, if needed.
  6. Click Continue button to confirm your signature.

Common Issues and Solutions

Signer didn't receive the email invitation

  • Check spam folders
  • Try clearing your browser cache

Signer is unable to view the document

  • Ensure you're using a supported browser and it's up to date
  • Try clearing your browser cache

Need to make changes after sending

  • When document is already send out you may have multiple options to make changes:
    • You can make a copy of the document to start from scratch, make necessary changes and resend the document.
    • You can delete the document if there are no signatures given.
    • You can void the document if there are signatures given.

Remember, Agrello is designed to make e-signing simple and efficient. If you encounter any issues not covered here or need further assistance, don't hesitate to reach out to our support team.

Happy e-signing!
