Name: The Evolution of Signing Processes: From Paper to Digital Signatures
Meta Title: The Evolution of Signing
Meta Description: In this article we give an overview of how the signing process has changed over time.
Keyword: digital signature, electronic signatures, digital signatures, electronic signature, sign documents, e signatures
Post Summary: In this post we will look at how signatures have evolved, and how you can avoid trying to sign a contract by trekking on horseback.
Post Body:
Remember the times when you had to sit and write out a contract with your quill and ink? And then you had to take it with a horse across the distance of a small country to get it signed by the other party? Probably not. In any case, those days are truly over.

Getting a document signed with an electronic signature is now easy. In this post we will look at how signatures have evolved, and how you can avoid trying to sign a contract by trekking on horseback.

First Electronic Signatures

The first real case of people using anything other than pen and paper or wax to sign came in 1869, with the case of Howley v Whipple, in New Hampshire, USA. This is pretty much the first time a signature was given through electronic means to sign something. It is known as the first case of an electronic signature in the US.

This case involved signatures over telegram, and the court ruled:

“It makes no difference whether operator writes with a steel pen an inch long attached to an ordinary penholder, or whether his pen be a copper wire a thousand miles long. Nor does it make any difference that in one case common record ink is used, while in another case a more subtle fluid, known as electricity, performs the same office.”

In non-legal speak that basically means the court held that it makes no difference if you sign something with a pen attached by a wire to a penholder, or write a signature via a telegram over a copper electricity wire. They are both legally the same signature. This case is usually surprising for people who didn't know that the first case of electronic signatures that early, but it is interesting to know that we have been trying to make signature processes more convenient since 150 years ago!

Telephonic and Fax Machine Signatures

The history of the early electronic form of signature continues, with the use of telephonic signatures. Telephonic signatures were a type of electronic signature that uses somebody’s recorded verbal assent or agreement in place of an ink signature. These were particularly popular in the early 20th century. They made verifying the signer's identity pretty easy, as you could cross check against their real voice.

Coming into the later 20th century, fax machines became a widespread method of giving wet ink signatures. The fax machine is a lot older than you might think!

It was invented in 1846 by Scottish inventor Alexander Bain. If you weren't already aware, a fax machine relies on a phone line. The machine scans the document and sees how many white and black areas there are (kind of like a barcode). It then sends these as one electric pulse down the phone line, to the receiving machine. The receiving machine then transmits this electronic pulse to its printer, which then prints it out and reproduces it.

To sign a document with a fax machine, you would give a wet ink signature with a pen, put your document into your fax machine and dial the fax number of the person you wanted to send your signed document to. The fax machine then scans the document and communicates with the receiving fax machine. The receiving machine reproduces a copy to the document, with the signature on it. This was a common way of signing legal documents back then, before we had any computerised e signature solution. It technically counts as an electronic signature, because, it is given over an electronic process.

Modern Electronic and Digital Signatures

Around the 1970s and 1980s, computers were also coming into more widespread use. The first basic digital signatures were conceived in 1978 by Ronald Rivest, Adi Shamir, and Len Adleman.

The first electronically signed agreement between the two countries was the USA and Ireland in 1998, underlining the growing importance of the promotion of electronic commerce.

In the 1990s and 2000s, regulations on electronic signatures started to come into force. In 2000, the USA signed the federal E-Sign Act. It essentially set out when electronic signatures can be used in the USA.

Here in Estonia, the Digital Signatures Act came into force in 2000 (later superseded by eIDAS) and the first digital signature was given in Estonia in 2002.

In 2014, in the EU, the Electronic Identification, Authentication and Trust Services Regulation - better known as eIDAS came into force. This set out various rules and regulations for digital signatures and digital services in the EU.

European Commission: eIDAS

In 2014, in the EU, the Electronic Identification, Authentication and Trust Services Regulation - better known as eIDAS came into force. This set out various rules and regulations for digital signatures, data, and digital services in the EU.

eIDAS set out different levels of digital signature. These are: simple electronic signatures, advanced electronic signature and qualified electronic signature.

Simple Electronic Signatures are ones that require little verification, such as a person's email signature.

Advanced Electronic Signatures reliably identify the signer and make a unique link between the signature and the signer.

Qualified Electronic Signatures are the highest level of signature. They are equivalent to a handwritten signature, as they are backed with a form of government ID and verified by a trust service provider.

Qualified electronic signatures rely on something called Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). With Public Key Infrastructure, there is a public, and private key to sign a document. The private key is used solely the signer to give electronic signatures. The public key is openly available and used by those who need to validate the signer’s electronic signature.

The European Commission setting out exactly which kinds of digital signature and electronic signature are valid, and fit with the existing legal framework means that people can trust what they use to sign. Electronic signature software now usually have advanced and qualified electronic signature methods such as Bank ID, Smart-ID and Mobile-ID.

Benefits of Electronic Signatures to Sign Documents

Even in the more modern times where fax machines were common, signing documents was still a pretty inconvenient process. If you don’t have a fax machine, then you need to sign documents on paper and send them through the postal system. That comes with a whole heap of security risks, such as important and confidential documents being intercepted by bad actors. Documents sent over the post also meant a slow process for parties involved, and mean there are no electronic records of documents.

As we all know, there’s the environmental cost of paper. It takes around 5 grams of carbon to make paper, which doesn’t sound like very much, right? But, if a business has 20 new employees to onboard, and the employment contracts are around 8 pages, that’s 160 pages, which is 800 grams of carbon. That’s like driving 8km in a diesel car. As well as a slower processes and lack of electronic records, creating more carbon emissions is not what we want to do with our signing process.

The increasingly widespread use of electronic signatures has certainly made people’s and businesses' lives a lot simpler and easier. Now, instead of printing or faxing things, you can just send over a document for someone to sign in the e sign tool. This has meant people can save time, and create and send documents in their e sign tool.

Drawbacks of Current Electronic Signature Tools

In e sign tools, documents are typically uploaded for signing from your computer. Usually they get converted to PDF. After that, you go through a process to assign signature fields to the people you need to sign the document. You then send out the document for signing. The parties will receive a link to the document, where they can then sign, usually by using some kind of virtual pen tool to draw their signature on.

But even that comes with some challenges and manual work. Sometimes if the e-signature tool you’re using is just for collecting e-signatures, you might need to spend some time in emails and other tools, negotiating terms, checking clauses with external lawyers, and filling in details in a word processor.

Using an all-in-one platform for your electronic signing can help with some of those troubles.

Using Agrello for Digital Signature

In Agrello, you can use creation tools and edit your documents in the draft phase as much as you’d like. This is through our Office integration- you basically have access to a full suite of Office tools, including Microsoft Word, right inside of your e-signing platform.

When you move to “approved for signing” you can then share the document with external parties who can check the contract with you. This means that there is no emailing things back and forth, you simply just invite those who need to be updated on the document.

When you send the document out for signing, the other party will receive an invite and be able to make an account to access and sign, or can sign quickly and easily with login-less signing. This means that everything is kept in one place and you don’t need to use multiple different tools to sign something. You can get everything signed electronically easily and quickly.

After signing is completed, you can then view all your documents in one place. Different management features such as folders means you can organise your documents easily. Permission and access management also allows you to invite members to your workspace. You can assign them to different folders, depending on what documents they need to see or edit. The allows users to see only specific document(s) that you want them to see.

If you open your signed document from Agrello in Acrobat Sign or Adobe Acrobat, you will also be able to see the digital certificate associated with your signatures. The digital certificate will tell you the signer identity, the time and date of the PDF signature, and whether the document and electronic signatures have been modified or not.

With Agrello's Zapier integrations, you can connect you signed documents and electronic signature processes with many different online services. For example, you could create a Zapier connection that sends your signed documents to Google Drive. Or, you could create a Google Forms that creates a contract whenever a news forms entry is submitted. This is great for small businesses who need to do a lot with relatively few, or disconnected tools.

Conclusion

We’ve come a long way since scratchings in stone tablets, signet rings, and fax machines. But the essential fact remains that signing documents for various purposes is not going away.

Signing documents once used to be a complicated process. You might have to have used a wax seal, or a telegraph. If you were in more modern times, maybe that meant using a fax machine to rudimentarily put signatures on a document. And if it was nowadays, you may have had to try and create and sign documents with multiple different softwares.

Now that signature creation methods have evolved significantly, it’s time to start thinking about how you can evolve your business processes.How could you make some of your signing processes more efficient?

If you want to talk to us about evolving your company’s signature and contract processes, you can contact us here.
Author: laura-findley

Name: The Future of Office Work: Four Predictions for 2026
Meta Title: The Future of Office Work: Four Predictions for 2026 | AI, Hybrid Work, 4-Day Week
Meta Description: What awaits office work in 2026? Research-backed analysis of AI assistants, hybrid work models, the four-day week experiment, and modern office culture.
Keyword: future of office work, AI in the workplace, artificial intelligence office, hybrid work, remote work, four-day work week, 4-day week, Bolt, work trends 2026, talent management, employer branding, office design, workplace culture
Post Summary: The end of a year invites reflection, and perhaps a little prophecy. For office work, this is particularly fraught territory. The past few years have delivered more upheaval than the preceding decade: remote work, hybrid arrangements, artificial intelligence, the four-day week. Some of these have become mundane. Others remain experimental. Where does it all lead?
Post Body:
What follows is not a forecast of certainties. It is an examination of four forces that, based on current evidence, appear likely to shape the office by 2026. Some will surprise; others will confirm what many already suspect. Together, they sketch a workplace that is at once familiar and strange.

1. Technology: AI Assistants and Automation Come to the Office

Artificial intelligence has arrived in the office, though not quite as the futurists promised. It has come not as a job-stealing robot, but as a quiet assistant handling tasks that nobody particularly wanted anyway—sorting emails, answering simple queries, populating spreadsheets.

The numbers tell an interesting story. A McKinsey survey found that 92% of companies plan to increase their AI investments. Ninety-two per cent. Yet when asked how many have truly integrated AI into daily operations—not as a pilot project tucked away in some corner, but as part of the everyday rhythm—the answer was 1%.

That gap speaks louder than any corporate declaration. The will exists; the know-how does not. Or rather: everyone senses that something is changing, but nobody yet sees clearly what it means for their own office. It is like standing in a landscape where the morning fog has not yet lifted. Outlines are visible, but details remain obscure.

Human resources shows the same pattern. According to Mercer, 84% of HR leaders believe their field will be substantially automated—chatbots answering employees' repetitive questions, algorithms scanning CVs, platforms assembling training programmes. But belief is a long way from reality. For now, "using AI" typically means someone, somewhere, is experimenting. Not that the whole organisation has begun to function differently.

What does AI actually do? Mostly the dull stuff. It does not replace the office worker; it takes on the portion of work that people did reluctantly anyway. Email triage. First-line customer support. Copying data from one system to another. These are tasks that nobody thinks about when getting up in the morning, yet they consume hours of the day.

Mercer suggests that more than half of executives expect productivity gains of 10–30%. If that happens—and it is a substantial "if"—it will not be because machines started thinking for people, but because people finally got to do what they were actually hired for.

Something called "agentic AI" is on the horizon. The jargon sounds complicated, but the idea is simple: systems that no longer wait for commands but act on their own initiative. Not entirely independently—humans remain the decision-makers—but autonomously enough to free workers from constant supervision. Like an assistant who no longer needs every step spelled out.

The key to this transformation lies not in the technology but in the people. Research shows that employees are ready. They believe AI will help them accomplish more and create new value. The question is whether leaders can act quickly and wisely enough to turn that readiness into reality. For now, most remain at the starting line—investments are growing, but maturity is not.

2. Work Arrangements: Hybrid Models, Asynchronous Communication, and the Four-Day Week

The pandemic years made one thing clear: work need not happen in an office. But what comes after the emergency passes? Does everyone return to the old rhythm?

They do not. A Morgan McKinley survey shows that 63% of job seekers consider flexibility—the ability to work from home part of the time—a decisive factor. Not a bonus to be appreciated. Decisive. Without it, they go elsewhere.

Here lies a contradiction. Mercer's data indicates that 76% of employees consider flexibility very important in their career choices. Yet only a third of HR leaders place it at the top of their priorities. It is as though two parties are speaking different languages—one insists it is essential, the other treats it as a convenience.

Why does this gap persist? A Cisco study offers one answer: lack of trust. Some 77% of employees believe that return-to-office mandates are really about control, not collaboration. That managers simply do not trust people to work properly at home. And 81% of employers admit—indirectly, but still—that this is so.

It is a peculiar situation. The work gets done, but trust is absent. And without trust, flexible arrangements can never truly function.

Meanwhile, the world moves on. More teams work across time zones, where not everyone can be "in the office" simultaneously. Meetings give way to written exchanges; real-time communication yields to asynchronous. What matters is not whether someone sits at a desk, but whether the work gets done.

And then there is the four-day week.

The idea sounds simple: same pay, fewer days, productivity maintained. According to the World Economic Forum, 92% of companies in pilot programmes continued with a four-day schedule after the trial ended. Employee stress fell, sick days decreased, turnover held steady or improved. Microsoft Japan reported a 40% productivity increase. Buffer saw 22% gains and a third fewer sick days.

Perhaps the most instructive case is Bolt, the San Francisco fintech company. In 2021, founder Ryan Breslow introduced a four-day week with much fanfare. Internal surveys glowed: 94% of employees wanted to keep it, 84% reported higher productivity. In January 2022, Breslow declared the policy permanent, telling CNBC he "couldn't imagine running a company any other way."

Three years later, he could imagine it after all. When Breslow returned as CEO in early 2025 after a controversial departure, one of his first acts was to end the four-day week—along with unlimited paid time off, which he called "totally broken." The luxuries staff had enjoyed, he wrote in an internal message, would be "on hold" until revenue increased substantially.

It is an honest story, if a deflating one. A shorter week is no magic wand that works in all circumstances. When the wind shifts, even the most progressive company may retreat. The policy that once seemed like the future can become, in harder times, a luxury.

A successful transition requires restructuring: fewer meetings, clearer priorities. And perhaps technological help—AI that handles some routine tasks may free exactly the hours that a shorter week demands.

Working hours and locations are no longer set in stone. But for new arrangements to truly function, managers and employees must find a common language. They are still searching.

3. Talent Management: New Approaches to Hiring and Retention

The diploma is no longer what it once was. More companies look at candidates and ask: what can you do? Not: where did you study? This shift—skills over credentials—is quiet but profound. Hiring decisions no longer rest on whether a candidate has the right education, but on whether they have the right abilities.

This brings a new challenge. If skills matter, they must also develop. Employees expect employers to help them learn. Mercer's data shows that 60% of workers trust their employer to invest in their development. But only 18% feel they actually benefit from it.

That gap is telling. Development programmes exist, but they do not work. Or more precisely: they work for ticking boxes, not for growing people. Form without substance. Workday suggests the solution may lie in technology—AI-based learning platforms that create personalised development plans for each employee. Not one programme for everyone, but a unique path for each person. Like having a pocket career coach who knows exactly what you should learn next.

But development is not the only thing people seek. They also want room to move.

81% of companies now say they prefer internal mobility to external hiring. Before seeking someone from outside, they look for someone within who might fill the role. Not only because it is cheaper—though it is—but because it retains people. An employee who sees an opportunity to grow will not start looking elsewhere.

Here the employer brand comes into play. Not logos and slogans, but what the company actually offers. The new generation of talent does not simply seek a salary. They seek a place that fits their life—flexible hours, development opportunities, mental health support, a culture where it is good to be.

And if they do not find it? They leave.

One aspect is particularly sharp: leadership. People do not leave companies; they leave managers. It is an old truth, but research confirms it again and again. Yet only 36% of firms offer their managers systematic development. As though leadership were an innate gift, not a skill that can be learned.

Here lies an opportunity. Companies that invest in their managers win twice—they retain existing talent and attract new. Every manager is an ambassador of the employer brand, whether they know it or not.

4. The Office Environment: Green, Communal, and Experience-Driven

If people can work from home, why should the office exist at all?

This question has prompted many companies to look at their spaces with fresh eyes. And the answer that emerges is surprisingly simple: the office must offer something that home cannot. Not merely a desk and chair, but an experience.

Part of that experience is the physical environment itself. Plants, natural light, green walls—this is no longer a designer's whim but a scientifically grounded choice. A Harvard School of Public Health study found that people working in green-certified buildings have cognitive function 26% better and 30% fewer sick days. Space affects thinking. An office that breathes helps the people working there to breathe better too.

But environment alone is not enough. What matters more is what happens in the office.

A Cisco study asked employees what they valued most about office culture. Some 92% answered: collaboration and a sense of community. This ranked higher than any other aspect. People do not come to the office to sit at a computer—that can be done at home. They come for other people. To exchange ideas. For spontaneous conversations by the coffee machine. To feel part of something larger.

This fundamentally changes the office's role. Rows of cubicles give way to collaboration spaces. Meeting rooms acquire quality cameras so remote workers feel equally included. Quiet corners emerge for those who need concentration, and open areas for those seeking company.

DLR Group calls this the experience-driven office—a place that reflects organisational values and supports employee wellbeing. Some companies have gone further: meditation rooms, gyms, art installations that tell the company's story. The office as a service, not merely as a space.

A question some firms have begun asking: do people leave the office more energised than when they arrived? If yes, the space is fulfilling its role. If not, something is wrong—and that something is probably not the number of desks or the speed of the wifi.

The future of office work is not a single fixed picture. It is a search for balance—between technology and humanity, flexibility and community, efficiency and wellbeing.

By 2026, we will see offices where artificial intelligence handles routine, work arrangements adapt to people's lives, talent management invests in development, and the office itself becomes a place people choose to be. Not from obligation, but from preference.

This is an opportunity. But also a responsibility—for those who shape the working environment.

One thing is certain: the 2026 office will not look like the 2019 office. And that is not bad news.

Sources:

  • McKinsey: Superagency in the Workplace (2025)
  • Mercer: Heads Up HR — 2025 is the Year of Agentic AI
  • Mercer 2025 Global Talent Trends
  • Workday: 25 Ways AI Will Change the Future of Work (2025)
  • Morgan McKinley: Remote Work & Four-Day Weeks (2025)
  • World Economic Forum: Four-Day Work Week (2025)
  • Cisco Global Hybrid Work Study (2025)
  • Habitaction: Sustainable Office Trends (2024)
  • DLR Group: Office Design Trends for 2025
  • CNBC: The 4-day workweek becomes permanent for tech company Bolt (2022)
  • eFinancialCareers: Bolt quietly cut its 4-day work week (2025)

Name: The Agrello web app 3.0 - a right tool for complex signing processes
Meta Title: The Agrello web app 3.0 - a right tool for complex signing processes
Meta Description: The Agrello Web App 3.0 is a powerful tool that enables businesses to simplify complex signing processes and make them more efficient.
Keyword: ID Web App, Signing Processes, Efficiency, Complex Signing, Businesses
Post Summary: Today we released a completely rewritten Agrello web app that introduces a new look and feel and a lot of new features for our web users. Our focus in this version is to make the complex signing process easier, faster and more secure.
Post Body:
From the signature to the signing process

‍

Throughout the first quarter of 2021, we interviewed dozens of legal advisors, investors, and startup founders to better understand the bottlenecks in the signing process of complex funding agreements. One theme that kept repeating is that managing the entire signing process is quite complicated.

There are usually many documents that need to be signed and there are many signatories involved. It is difficult to keep track of which documents have been signed by everyone, which are still waiting to be signed or are still in the preparation phase.

Based on these insights from people who deal with complex signing processes on a daily basis, we redesigned our web app from the ground up with two main focuses:

  • Process Overview
  • Transparency and simplicity at the document level.

‍

5 seconds for a complete overview of your signing process

‍

After logging into the Agrello web app, you now have a complete process overview of your signing flow. It takes a maximum of 5 seconds to see which documents are still in draft, which are waiting to be signed or which are already signed.

‍

One good thing about the Agrello is that when you prepare the document for signing, you can update new versions of the files to be signed until the first signature is given. This way the document itself stays the same, and you can already share it with the future signers and keep them updated and prepared for the signing.

‍

Speed, focus, transparency

‍

We've also completely redesigned the document screen to give you more space, clear focus, better visibility, and additional transparency over digital signatures.

‍

Based on our testing, adding 3 signers to the document is 2-5 times faster in the Agrello web app than in other popular electronic signature tools. Imagine the difference in the case of 10+ signers, which is quite common in complex signature processes like closing a startup's funding round.

Furthermore, signing multiple files in a document requires only one digital signature, as it applies to the entire contents of the document, no matter how many files are in it. There is absolutely no need to repeatedly drag signature fields into the PDF, as the signature sheet is automatically added to the end of the signed file.

We've made managing people in the new Agrello app much easier. Invite people to the document using their emails or simply send them a share link via Slack or another messenger tool. You can invite people as viewers or signers and change their roles later with a click.

We've also brought more transparency right into the document details view. Now you can conveniently preview the signature sheet from the toolbar, check the individual hash values of the digital signature, and see the signed document with the digital signature sheet attached to the original document. We have also retained all document output formats: Original files, signed copy, signature sheet, and finally the all-encompassing ASiC container.

Way forward

‍

In addition to the improvements mentioned above, you'll discover dozens of other new features in the new Agrello web app. All of these features were developed with feedback we received from people who need to sign or have signed dozens of documents every day.

In the coming months, we will continue to work on the new features that will make signing even easier, provide better control over the process, and make collaboration more effective in the complex signing cases. Stay tuned!

Name: The Agrello web app 3.1 makes signing easier
Meta Title: Sign Easily with Agrello Web App 3.1
Meta Description: Agrello Web App 3.1 makes it easier than ever to sign documents. Learn more about its features and how it can save you time.
Keyword: Agrello Web App, Signing, Easier, Documents, Time-saving
Post Summary: In April, we introduced the completely redesigned Agrello web app. It was very well received by our users and we saw great growth in the web app. The creation and signing of documents grew fourfold via the new Agrello web app.
Post Body:
This month's release makes the web app even easier to use. We're introducing new web-based onboarding and a brand new way to digitally sign documents exclusively on web app.

‍

Password-less login makes onboarding easier, faster, and more secure

‍

The Agrello application has been password-less from the beginning because we just don't trust passwords much.

Mainly because passwords are easy to crack. Phishing, dictionary attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks have become mainstream vulnerabilities.

For a password to be secure, it also has to be very long, unique to a particular service, and contain special characters. An average user can't remember all that, so they use often the same passwords for different services. This in turn makes all services vulnerable, even if they are very careful about their own cybersecurity settings.

Any service that stores user passwords immediately becomes a lucrative target for hackers who can gain access to thousands of user passwords, and we don't want that.

We have a better solution for you! From your email, we can tell if you are a new or existing user and we'll send you a one-time login code via e-mail. No password stored in our service, no password to forget, no password to attack.

‍

Digital signatures go on the web

‍

Our strong digital signature is based on the industry-standard XAdES signature format and ASiC document containers. Even if you download a signed copy in PDF format with your visual signature, the only source of truth is still the XAdES+ASiC combination stored in our service.

This combination dictates that any digital signature can only be issued if the signer is in direct possession of the signing private key, which is not known to anyone else and cannot be stored anywhere other than on a specific, dedicated physical device under the signer's sole control - a mobile phone, smart card, etc.

In our hectic daily lives, this is a major drawback because it requires users to take more steps to be able to sign than they have patience for.

That's why we decided to introduce a whole new kind of digital signature, still based on the principles of strong digital signatures, but not requiring a special security device. We are introducing a Basic signature that complements our existing Secure signature and makes signing faster and easier.

‍

We are on a mission to simplify the process around the contract lifecycle and help you make the best agreements to protect your interests. Simplifying the contracting process while keeping it secure is one step of many in this direction.

‍

Have fun signing!

Sign with Agrello

Name: The next step in document automation: Agrello  in Zapier
Meta Title: Automating Documents with Agrello and Zapier
Meta Description: Learn how Agrello and Zapier can help automate documents. Read on to find out more about this document automation solution and how it can save you time.
Keyword: Zapier, Document Automation, Automation Solution, Time-Saving
Post Summary: Agrello Zapier integration allows you to connect Agrello with hundreds of tools to automate your document flows.
Post Body:
Agrello's Zapier integration allows you to connect Agrello to hundreds of tools to automate your document flow.

When you digitize your document flows, you're likely to encounter a variety of different tools: Document editing in Microsoft Word, sending and sharing via email or Slack, collecting signatures in Agrello or Adobe Sign, storing and archiving in Dropbox, or Google Drive. They're all great tools in their own right, but switching back and forth between them can cause errors and cost you a lot of time.

What if there was a way to automate the processes? Data from one point, document templates from another, then approval and signature collection - all combined into one seamless process.

One option would be to hire an expensive IT consulting firm to develop a set of integrations for you. But there's also an alternative called Zapier that lets you create automations yourself without writing a single line of code.

Now you can also incorporate Agrello's platform into your automated document flows in Zapier, making contract lifecycle management even easier.

‍

Your files to Agrello for automatic signing

You can start your automations by connecting Agrello to your environment where you host your document files. For example, if you connect a special Google Drive folder to Agrello in Zapier, you can simply skip the manual file upload to Agrello. As soon as you upload a new file to this folder, it'll be automatically copied to Agrello.

Learn about connecting Google Drive to Agrello.

‍

Your data flows into document templates and then into signing

Copying and pasting customer data into your standard contract templates, like NDAs or T&Cs, can be time-consuming and annoying. With Agrello's Zapier integration, you can save yourself that.

Just set up a reusable template in Agrello and connect Agrello to your data source and your documents will be prepared like magic.

For example, you can connect your Google Sheet to a template in Agrello, and every time you add a new row to your spreadsheet, a new contract will be created in Agrello and ready to sign.

Learn about how to connect Google Sheets to Agrello.

‍

You can automate it even further by having your customers fill out the necessary data using Google Forms. In this case, you don't even have to bother with spreadsheets.

Check out this guide about Google Forms on Agrello.

‍

Keep your team on the same page

Events that happen in Agrello can be used as triggers in Zapier to get another software to do a task for you.

For example, if you integrate Agrello with Slack, you can get a quick update whenever a new document is created in Agrello.

Currently, we provide the following events to Zapier as triggers:

- A new document is created in Agrello

- A new Space is created in Agrello

- A new Template is added to Agrello

The full list of available actions, triggers, and searches can be found here.

‍

‍

Never forget when you have to sign a monthly expense report

Zapier also lets you set up scheduled triggers. These can remind you to review documents in Agrello on a regular basis.

For example, you can set up a monthly trigger to check a specific field for a document to sign. This combination can help you check if the monthly expense report is ready to be signed.

As you can see, Zapier's possibilities are endless. You can find hundreds of tools on the Zapier.com website.

We're working to add more features to our Zapier integration in the near future to make your life even easier. In the meantime, try out our Zapier integration, and let's know what you think.

Name: Three ways companies are under threat from cybercrime
Meta Title: Three ways companies are under threat from cybercrime
Meta Description: Which are the three most common threats of cybercrime and how companies could avoid them.
Keyword: cybercrime, company, threats, cyber security
Post Summary: People are becoming more and more electronically fit if not even bionic. We take digital for granted so much that we do not even notice the threats around the virtual world. Being a victim of cybercrime can be very damaging, both financially and emotionally.
Post Body:
The CoViD-19 emergency showed our dependency on virtual. It also raised several concerns about digital safety. According to McAfee, cybercrime cost the global economy 600 billion dollars during 2017. Now is an excellent time to address the types of cyber attacks and the damage they inflict.

‍

File-based attacks

Currently, the noise of information over the internet is so intense that getting baited by something malicious is a high risk. The most popular way of initiating breaches is through malicious files planted into the victims’ devices. Commonly it happens by malicious URLs or spoofed emails, which bait the victim into downloading a file.

In the professional world, the most likely successful breach is through a spoofed email. Email spoofing means that a 3rd party can send emails under someone else’s email address. Contrary to intuition, this is still one of the simplest ways of attack, as email protocols do not involve any authentication. Many people receive loads of emails regularly, opening a malicious file in a well crafted spoofed email can happen to anyone.

Besides email spoofing, there is a wide array of types of attacks which are becoming more popular and are severely harmful:

  • ransomware;
  • phishing;
  • data breaches;
  • identity theft;
  • information leakage.

The list above shows the top cyber attacks.

According to a 2020 Webroot report, 93% of such file-based cyber-attacks detected involve polymorphic malware. The same malicious file is spread massively and has a different program code for each victim. This approach significantly increases the possibility that anti-virus software will not detect a malicious file.

One way to avoid being under the risk of such attacks, emails should always include a signature of the sender. Access to critical information should require two-factor authentication with multiple devices.

‍

Fileless attacks

This type of Fileless attack usually starts with another malicious email sent to the victim. However, the attack itself does not involve a corrupt file, but other methods of getting access to a personal device. This approach poses a big concern for anti-virus software developers as such attacks are less detectable than file-based attacks.

Usually, it works through a malicious link in the email from the attacker. This link runs a Flash executable in the browser, which gives access to the device for downloading the victim’s information. It makes it possible to plant keyloggers and other phishing devices. Learn more about this here.

The best way to avoid such attacks is to be diligent with the emails you receive and to disable Flash in the browser.

‍

Insider threat

Insider threat to cybersecurity is as simple as it sounds. Trusted colleagues or employees are deleting, tampering, or leaking sensitive information, accessing it during their daily work. As common understanding is that cyber threats are caused by hackers with the intent of receiving some benefits, then statistics show that most of cybersecurity breaches caused by employees or partners are accidental or caused by bad ICT infrastructure or cyberpolicies.

Most of such cases are emerging from negligence, intense work with lots of cyber noise, lack of cybersecurity knowledge, or other factors that can make trusted people unintentionally harm the company.

Such unintentional insider threats are usually due to a lack of cybersecurity infrastructure combined with bad practices like:

  • software lacking security;
  • devices lacking security;
  • bad email practices.

A significant problem for large companies is to keep everything in sync between a vast number of autonomous departments. Thus, software implementation is a long, painful, and expensive process. It often creates the tendency to get stuck with outdated legacy software, which cannot adopt up-to-date cybersecurity features. 99.9% of all cyberattacks exploit vulnerabilities known for at least a year.

Additionally, we often find that the software lacks interoperability between different departments and keeps system administrators under severe stress that opens the door for human error. Device usage and access management open severe vulnerabilities. Companies that are in most risk have:

  • systems in place that give room for downloading malware;
  • have unsecured WiFi networks or
  • offer their employees devices, which are vulnerable in case of loss or theft.

All such vulnerabilities can be abolished with technology that already exists and is not too complex to adopt, use, and maintain.

Devices and software can also be unsecured due to lacking access systems and practices. Of course, remembering several complicated passwords is too much for many people. One possibility is to write them down, which opens up a physical vulnerability. Many people prefer to use the same password for many places. There is also a significant amount of people who do not feel any threat from establishing an easily hacked password like “123456” or “password” etc.
‍

Making access secure

One possibility is to use password rules that do not allow simple passwords to mitigate that vulnerability, but this still forces people to write down passwords or use one for many. Another possibility is to use password managers. However, password managers also need to be secure, and if the password for the password manager is lacking, it creates even a more significant vulnerability.

The most advanced option is to use two-factor authentication (2FA). There are different ways of applying 2FA. The most common choice is to use a conventional password and a one-time password (OTP), either sent to an SMS or generated in a mobile application. That, of course, makes access much more cumbersome. Now there is also a modern way of 2FA using PKI signatures so that the first factor of the 2FA is a private key stored in a device, which as the second factor, is encrypted with a pin code memorized by the account holder. The latter method is a significant boost to security. It avoids the risk of account credentials massively leaking as a hacker would have to breach each private key holding device separately.

Pin protected private key in a mobile device is an important leap in security. However, it is still vulnerable to brute force attacks on the mobile, where the encrypted private key is extracted and tried with all possible pin codes until there is an answer. This requires something that could restrict extraction of the encrypted private key, while controlling, how many times the pin code can be tried (industry standard is three times). This is something similar to cards with a chip like banking cards and some ID cards.

Such chips are called secure enclaves. Fido Alliance is an industry association, which with the purpose of abolishing passwords, has gathered together worlds digital leaders to make standards for secure enclaves to create interoperability that extends to everyday apps. Thanks to this association a remarkable amount of smartphones now have integrated hardware security module (HSM), which makes it possible to store the private key in the most bulletproof way. This not only has increased security, but also has enabled the ease of use of biometrics as authentication, which replaces pin codes.

The truth is that still a minor part of all global smartphones have an HSM. Not all Apple devices have it and very few Android models come with an HSM for app development. Agrello is working on a mechanism that makes it possible to prevent brute force attacks also for phones that do not have a secure enclave. It is a cryptographic system that requires two or more private keys that correspond to a combined public key only when matched after decryption with a pin code. That makes it possible to store one-half of the necessary credentials in the phone and the other in another remotely stored and secured dedicated device, which could also be an HSM. The result is that there would not be enough information available to brute force the pin-code or produce a digital signature by hacking a single device.

Name: Tiimide suurimad väljakutsed uue tööriista kasutusele võtmisel
Meta Title: Väljakutsed uute tööriistade kasutusele võtmisel
Meta Description: Suurematel meeskondadel on uute tööriistade kasutuselevõtt keeruline, loe kuidas seda kiiremini ja kergemalt teha.
Keyword: lepinguhaldus, allkirjastamine, digiallkirjastamine, slack, teams
Post Summary: Jagame suuremaid väljakutseid ja mõttekohti, millega meeskonnad uute tööriistade kasutusele võtmisel kokku puutuvad.
Post Body:
Me kõik teame, et millegi uue õppimine võib olla aeganõudev ning paras väljakutse. Veelgi keerulisem on muudatuste sisseviimine suuremas tiimis, kus igaühel on oma harjumused ning tõekspidamised. Muudatused on aga tihti vajalikud, sest olemasolevast protsessist saab pikema aja jooksul arengu pidur.  

Dokumentidega töötamises toimusid suuremad muudatused siis, kui kõik muutus digitaalseks. Tänaseks oleme sellega suuresti juba harjunud ning digitaalne asjaajamine on uus normaalsus, sealhulgas ka digitaalne allkirjastamine. Tihtipeale juhtub aga nii, et esialgne innovatsioon pidurdub ning järgmiste uuenduste kasutuselevõtt on järjest vaevalisem.

Seekord jagame suuremaid väljakutseid ja mõttekohti, millega meeskonnad uute tööriistade kasutusele võtmisel kokku puutuvad.

‍

Probleem peab olema piisavalt põletav

Uut tööriista hakatakse otsima enamasti siis, kui tekkinud on piisavalt suur probleem ning vaja on lahendust. Näiteks mingi ülesande täitmine võtab liiga palju inimressurssi või protsess ei ole optimaalne. Lepingute sõlmimisel on peamiseks probleemiks nende ettevalmistamisele kuluv aeg. Kui lepingute sõlmimist on palju ning seda on vaja teha copy-paste meetodil ühele ja samale lepingupõhjale, tundub sellise ülesande korduv täitmine ka töötajale demotiveeriv.

Probleemi olemasolust saavad kiiremini aru need, kellel on kasutusel mõni tööaja mõõtmise töörist, näiteks Uku või Toggl. Kui lepingute ettevalmistamisele kuluv aeg on ebamõistlikult suur, tuleb mõelda parematele lahendustele.

Agrello võimaldab olemasolevate lepingupõhjade muutmist korduvkasutatavateks lepingupõhjadeks ning korraga saab allkirjastamiseks ette valmistada ka hulgaliselt lepinguid. Nii võib kokku hoida muljetavalda arvu väärtuslikke tunde.

‍

Tööriistu on liiga palju

Tänapäeval on iga asja jaoks turul mitmeid erinevaid digitaalseid tööriistu. Dokumentide ettevalmistamiseks kasutatakse endiselt kõige enam Microsoft Wordi, kuid muude ülesannete jaoks on olemas palju veebipõhiseid tööriistu. Näiteks dokumente saab hoiustada Google Drive’is või Dropboxis, meeskonna suhtlus käib Slackis või Teamsis ja müügiprotsesse hallatakse Pipedrive’is või mõnes muus CRM tööriistas.

Iga ettevõte valib välja enda jaoks sobivamad ning tekib kindel töövoog. Kuna tööriistu on kasutusel suhteliselt palju, siis nende vahel orienteerumine ning uue kasutusele võtmine võib olla tülikas. Seetõttu on oluline, et kasutatavad tööriistad oleksid lihtsad ja mugavad ning nende õppimine ei nõuaks liiga suurt pingutust. Eriti efektiivne on see, kui erinevaid tööriistu saab omavahel ühendada.

Agrello saad läbi Zapieri integratsioonide ühendada praktiliselt kõikide oma veebitööriistadega, näiteks Pipedrive’i, Google Formsi või Google Drive’ga. Samuti on kasulik, kui üks tööriist katab mitu erinevat protsessi osa. Agelloga saab kaetud pea kogu lepingu sõlmimisega seotud töövoog ning seda kõike on võimalik teha koos oma meeskonnaga läbi jagatud kaustade.

‍

Oluline on aktiivse eestvedaja olemasolu

Muutused on tihti keerulised ning nende elluviimiseks on vaja aktiivset ja kindlameelset eestvedajat. Olgu selleks siis tegevjuht, tiimijuht või mõni ambitsioonikas töötaja, kes otsib võimalusi, kuidas oma tööd efektiivsemalt teha. Oluline on muuta mõtteviisi, et uued asjad on alati keerulised ja ebamugavad ning asendada see valmidusega eksperimenteerimiseks.

Dokumentide allkirjastamise juures on oluline mõelda ka oma vastaspoolele ning sellele, et allkirjastamine oleks nende jaoks võimalikult lihtne ja kiire. Isegi kui suuremad partnerid suunavad sind neile sobivasse keskkonda lepinguid allkirjastama, võid teinekord eestvedajana neile mõnda mugavamat lahendust tutvustada. Kui see ka ei õnnestu, tasub teises keskkonnas allkirjastatud dokumendid sellest hoolimata Agrellosse hoiustamise eesmärgil üles laadida.

‍

Mistahes väljakutseid tuleb teie tiimil ületada, Agrello on lepingute valdkonnas usaldusväärne partner. Võta meiega personaalselt ühendust ning aitame paika sättida kõige efektiivsemad protsessid vastavalt sinu ettevõtte vajadustele.

‍

Name: Parimad dokumendivoo automatiseerimise tööriistad aastaks 2025
Meta Title: Tippdokumendiautomaatika tööriistad aastaks 2025: Sujuvam töövoog
Meta Description: Avasta 2025. aasta parimad dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad, mis on loodud töövoogude lihtsustamiseks, täpsuse parandamiseks ja aja säästmiseks. Uuri lahendusi nagu Agrello, ClickUp ja PandaDoc, et automatiseerida ülesandeid nagu lepingute loomine, andmete sisestamine ja kinnitamine.
Keyword: dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad, tippdokumenditööriistad 2025, töövoo sujuvdamine, lepingu automatiseerimine, e-allkirjad, dokumendihaldustarkvara, töövoo optimeerimine, Agrello, ClickUp, PandaDoc, äriefektiivsus, nõuetele vastavuse automatiseerimine, dokumentide hulgiloomine
Post Summary: Käsitsi dokumentide käsitlemine põhjustab sageli ebaefektiivsust, inimlikke vigu ja tarbetuid viivitusi töövoogudes. Ettevõtted, kes tegelevad suure hulga paberimajanduse või keeruka dokumentatsiooniga, vajavad nutikamaid lahendusi, et hoida operatsioonid sujuvana. Dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad pakuvad usaldusväärset viisi korduvate ülesannete, nagu lepingute loomine, andmete sisestamine ja kinnitamisprotsessid, lihtsustamiseks.
Post Body:
Need tööriistad vähendavad mitte ainult administratiivset töökoormust, vaid parandavad ka täpsust ja tagavad kõigis dokumentides järjepidevuse. Alates kohandatud lepingute loomisest kuni arvete töötlemiseni suures mahus, on dokumendiautomaatikatarkvara hädavajalik ettevõtetele, kes soovivad parandada efektiivsust ja vastavust nõuetele.

Käesolevas artiklis uurime parimaid dokumendiautomaatika tööriistu, mis praegu saadaval on. Iga lahendus on mõeldud konkreetsete vajaduste rahuldamiseks, pakkudes funktsioone nagu masstootmine, e-allkirjad ja täiustatud integratsioonid. Avasta, kuidas need tööriistad võivad optimeerida sinu töövooge, kõrvaldada käsitsi tekkivaid kitsaskohti ja anda sinu meeskonnale võimalus keskenduda strateegilisematele ülesannetele.

2. Mis on dokumendiautomaatika tööriist?

Dokumendiautomaatika tööriist on tarkvara, mis on loodud dokumentide loomise, töötlemise ja haldamise lihtsustamiseks. See asendab käsitsi ülesanded automatiseeritud töövoogudega, tagades järjepidevuse, vähendades vigu ja säästes aega. Need tööriistad on eriti kasulikud ettevõtetele, kes käsitlevad regulaarselt suures mahus lepinguid, arveid, ettepanekuid või muid korduvaid dokumente.

Dokumendiautomaatika keskendub peamiselt:

     
  • Korduvate ülesannete automatiseerimisele: sellised ülesanded nagu andmesisestus, vormindamine ja dokumentide genereerimine viiakse läbi tõhusalt ilma käsitsi sekkumiseta.
    •  
  • Mallide kasutamisele: Eelkujundatud mallid võimaldavad kasutajatel kiiresti luua standardiseeritud dokumente, säilitades professionaalse ilme.
    •  
  • Integratsioonile teiste süsteemidega: Paljud tööriistad ühenduvad CRM-ide, ERP-ide ja pilvesalvestusplatvormidega, tagades sujuva andmevoo platvormide vahel.
    •  
  • Vastavuse tagamisele: Automaatika vähendab vigade riski juriidilistes või regulatiivsetes dokumentides, tagades nende vastavuse nõutud standarditele.

Näiteks ettevõte, mis haldab kliendilepinguid, saab kasutada automaatikatööriistu, et luua personaliseeritud lepinguid, tõmmates andmeid otse oma CRM-ist. See kõrvaldab käsitsi andmesisestuse, kiirendab protsessi ja tagab dokumentide ühtsuse.

Lisaks efektiivsusele parandavad need tööriistad ka koostööd, võimaldades mitmel kasutajal dokumente reaalajas redigeerida, kinnitada ja lõplikult vormistada. Kasvava kiiruse ja täpsuse nõudluse tõttu äriprotsessides on automatiseeritud dokumendihalduse tööriistad muutunud asendamatuks varaks.

3. Dokumendiautomaatika tööriistade kasutamise eelised

Dokumendiautomaatika tööriista rakendamine toob ettevõtetele märkimisväärseid eeliseid, olenemata nende suurusest. Lisaks aja säästmisele parandavad need tööriistad täpsust, vastavust ja üldist efektiivsust kriitiliste dokumentide käsitlemisel. Järgnevalt on loetletud peamised eelised:

1. Aja ja kulude kokkuhoid

Käsitsi dokumentide loomine ja haldamine võib olla aeganõudev ja töömahukas. Dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad vähendavad seda koormust, võimaldades:

     
  • Dokumentide kohest loomist eelseadistatud mallide abil.
    •  
  • Korduvate ülesannete automatiseerimist, nagu andmesisestus ja vormindamine.
    •  
  • Vajadust käsitsi paranduste järele, säästes nii aega kui ka tööjõukulusid.

2. Paranenud täpsus

Inimlikud vead dokumentides, eriti lepingutes või arvete puhul, võivad viia vastavuse rikkumiste ja rahaliste kaotusteni. Automaatika tööriistad aitavad seda riski vähendada, pakkudes:

     
  • Sisustandardimist mallide abil, et tagada järjepidevus.
    •  
  • Andmete tõmbamist otse integreeritud süsteemidest nagu CRM-id või ERP-id või Excelist, et vältida kirjavigu või andmete mittevastavusi.

3. Paranenud vastavus

Määruslikke nõudeid käsitlevates tööstusharudes on vastavuse tagamine ülioluline. Dokumendiautomaatika tagab:

     
  • Nõuetekohase vormindamise ja vastavuse juriidilistele või tööstusstandarditele.
    •  
  • Sisseehitatud versioonikontrolli ja auditeerimisjäljed muutuste ja kinnituste jälgimiseks.

4. Skaleeritavus

Ettevõtete kasvades muutub suurema hulga dokumentide haldamine keerulisemaks. Automaatika tööriistad saavad mahuga kergesti hakkama, võimaldades:

     
  • Massdokumentide loomist suurte andmekogumite jaoks.
    •  
  • Kinnituste ja töövoogude optimeerimist kiirema töötlemise jaoks.

5. Parem koostöö

Paljudel dokumendiautomaatika tööriistadel on koostööfunktsioonid, mis võimaldavad meeskondadel:

     
  • Dokumente redigeerida ja üle vaadata reaalajas.
    •  
  • Dokumente osakondade vahel sujuvalt jagada ja kinnitada.

Dokumendiautomaatika tarkvara kasutuselevõtuga saavad ettevõtted keskenduda strateegilistele algatustele, selle asemel, et tegeleda administratiivsete ülesannete koormaga. Eelised ulatuvad kaugemale lihtsalt tootlikkusest, aidates organisatsioonidel pakkuda klientidele ja sidusrühmadele professionaalsemat ja sujuvamat kogemust.

4. Parimad dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad 2025. aastal

Paljude saadaval olevate valikute korral sõltub õige dokumendiautomaatika tööriista valik teie organisatsiooni vajadustest, nagu skaleeritavus, integratsioonivõimalused ja konkreetsed funktsioonid. Allpool on mõned parimad tööriistad, mida kaaluda, igaühel on ainulaadsed eelised:

Agrello‍

Agrello on silmapaistev lahendus lepingute töövoogude automatiseerimiseks. See lihtsustab mitme lepingu loomist samaaegselt, kasutades Microsoft Wordi malle ja importides andmeid Exceli tabelitest. See massiline loomise funktsioon vähendab oluliselt käsitsi pingutust, muutes selle ideaalseks ettevõtetele, kes haldavad suuri lepingute mahtusid.

Lisaks pakub Agrello turvalisi ja seaduslikult vastavuses olevaid e-allkirju, mis vastavad Ühendkuningriigi ja EL-i standarditele. Selle redigeeritavad mallid võimaldavad kasutajatel lepinguid kohandada ilma nullist alustamata, pakkudes nii paindlikkust kui ka efektiivsust. Agrello on tugev valik organisatsioonidele, kes otsivad sujuvat automaatika ja elektroonilise allkirjastamise kombinatsiooni.

Lisateave Agrello kohta

ClickUp

ClickUp on mitmekülgne tootlikkusplatvorm, mis sisaldab võimsaid dokumendihaldusvõimalusi. Selle dokumendiautomaatika funktsioonid on integreeritud suuremasse tööriistakomplekti, mis on mõeldud ülesannete haldamiseks, koostööks ja töövoogude optimeerimiseks. ClickUp Docs toetab reaalajas redigeerimist, rikkalikku vormindamist ja koostööd, muutes selle suurepäraseks valikuks meeskondadele, kes vajavad nii projekti kui dokumendihaldust ühes platvormis.

Tutvu ClickUpiga

PandaDoc

PandaDoc on spetsialiseerunud müügi ja ettepanekute töövoogude lihtsustamisele. Selle dokumendiautomaatika funktsioonid lihtsustavad ettepanekute ja lepingute loomist, redigeerimist ja jälgimist. CRM-idega, nagu Salesforce ja HubSpot, sujuv integreerimine võimaldab andmetel voolata vaevata, vähendades vigu ja parandades efektiivsust.

Reaalajas koostööfunktsioonid muudavad meeskondade jaoks dokumentide kallal töötamise lihtsaks, samas kui selle täiustatud analüütika pakub ülevaateid dokumentide toimivuse ja kliendikaasatuse kohta.

Avasta PandaDoc

Docupilot

Docupilot on tuntud oma kasutajasõbraliku lähenemise poolest dokumendiautomaatikale. See võimaldab kasutajatel kujundada kohandatavaid malle ja luua professionaalseid dokumente minutitega. Ideaalne ettevõtetele, kes peavad looma juriidilisi dokumente, lepinguid või arveid, pakub Docupilot täiustatud võimalusi dokumentide kohandamiseks konkreetsete vajaduste järgi.

Selle pilvepõhine platvorm tagab ligipääsetavuse kõikjalt ja integratsioonid populaarsete tööriistadega, nagu Zapier, muudavad selle hõlpsasti olemasolevatesse töövoogudesse sobivaks.

Külasta Docupilotit

Klippa DocHorizon

Klippa DocHorizon keskendub andmete ekstraheerimise ja dokumentide digiteerimise automatiseerimisele optilise märgituvastuse (OCR) abil. See sobib eriti hästi ettevõtetele, kes tegelevad füüsiliste dokumentide, arvete ja kviitungitega, muudab need otsitavateks digifailideks.

Tööriist sisaldab ka täiustatud andmete valideerimise ja turvafunktsioone, tagades tundliku teabe töötlemisel täpsuse ja vastavuse.

Lisateave Klippa kohta

Need tööriistad esindavad juhtivaid lahendusi dokumendiautomaatika tarkvaras, pakkudes lahendusi ettevõtetele igas suuruses ja tööstusharudes. Igaüks neist pakub unikaalseid funktsioone, et lihtsustada töövooge, parandada täpsust ja suurendada koostööd.

5. Kuidas valida oma ettevõttele parim dokumendiautomaatika tööriist?

Õige dokumendiautomaatika tööriista valimine nõuab hoolikat kaalumist teie organisatsiooni vajaduste ja töövoogude osas. Erinevate valikute hulgast keskendumine spetsiifilistele kriteeriumidele aitab leida teie nõuetele vastava parima lahenduse.

1. Määratle oma ettevõtte vajadused

Enne tööriistade uurimist on oluline mõista oma dokumendihalduse väljakutseid. Näiteks:

     
  • Kas vajate dokumentide masstootmise võimalusi?
    •  
  • Kas e-allkirjad või vastavus konkreetsetele juriidilistele standarditele on prioriteet?
    •  
  • Kas sujuv integreerimine CRM-ide, ERP-ide või teiste süsteemidega on vajalik?

Nende vajaduste määratlemisel saate keskenduda tööriistadele, mis pakuvad otseselt neid nõudmisi rahuldavaid funktsioone.

2. Arvesta skaleeritavust

Valige lahendus, mis suudab koos teie ettevõttega kasvada. Teie tegevuse laienedes kasvab ka dokumentide hulk ja keerukus. Skaleeritav tööriist tagab, et te ei ületaks selle võimeid ning suudab hallata lisakasutajaid, suuremaid andmekogumeid ja keerukamaid töövooge.

3. Hinnake kasutusmugavust

Kasutajasõbralik liides on meeskondadele laialdaseks kasutuselevõtuks kriitiline. Tööriistad, millel on intuitiivne disain ja minimaalne õppimiskõver, vähendavad ulatusliku koolituse vajadust ja võimaldavad teie meeskonnal kiiresti automaatikast kasu saada.

4. Kontrollige integratsioonivõimalusi

Teie dokumendiautomaatika tööriist peaks sujuvalt integreeruma juba kasutatava tarkvaraga, näiteks CRM-idega (nt Salesforce, HubSpot), projektihaldusplatvormidega (nt ClickUp) või raamatupidamissüsteemidega. See tagab andmete sujuva liikumise süsteemide vahel, vähendades käsitsi sisestamist ja vigu.

5. Seadke prioriteediks turvalisus ja vastavus

Kui teie dokumendid sisaldavad tundlikku või reguleeritud teavet, on turvalisus ja vastavus kriitilised. Otsige funktsioone nagu krüpteerimine, auditeerimisjäljed ja vastavus standarditele nagu GDPR, HIPAA või muud tööstusharuspetsiifilised regulatsioonid.

6. Proovige ja hinnake tuge

Paljud dokumendiautomaatika tööriistad pakuvad tasuta prooviversioone või demosid. Kasutage võimalust testida võtmefunktsioone ja vaadata, kas tööriist vastab teie ootustele. Samuti arvestage klienditoe kvaliteeti, sealhulgas reageerimisaegu ja saadavalolevaid ressursse nagu juhendid ja kasutajate kogukonnad.

Keskendudes nendele teguritele, saate tagada, et valitud dokumendiautomaatika tarkvara on kooskõlas teie organisatsiooni eesmärkidega ja parandab üldist efektiivsust.

6. Kokkuvõte

Dokumendiautomaatika tööriista kasutuselevõtt on strateegiline samm, mis suurendab tootlikkust, täpsust ja vastavust teie äritegevuses. Need tööriistad lihtsustavad korduvaid ülesandeid, võimaldavad sujuvat koostööd ja vähendavad käsitsi dokumendihaldusega seotud riske.

Olgu vaja masstootmist, turvalisi e-allkirju või täiustatud integratsioone, lahendused nagu Agrello, ClickUp, PandaDoc, Docupilot ja Klippa DocHorizon pakuvad tugevaid funktsioone, mis on kohandatud erinevatele ärivajadustele. Hoolikalt oma nõudmisi hindades ja arvestades tegureid nagu skaleeritavus, kasutusmugavus ja turvalisus, saate valida õige tööriista, mis muudab teie dokumenditöövood.

Õige tarkvara olemasolul saab teie meeskond keskenduda strateegilistele algatustele, jättes dokumentide haldamise keerukused automaatikale. Tulemuseks on mitte ainult paranenud efektiivsus, vaid ka professionaalsem ja usaldusväärsem kogemus teie klientidele ja sidusrühmadele.

7. KKK dokumendiautomaatika tööriistade kohta

Mis on dokumendiautomaatika tööriist?

Dokumendiautomaatika tööriist on tarkvara, mis automatiseerib dokumentide loomise, töötlemise ja haldamise. See kõrvaldab käsitsi tehtavad ülesanded nagu andmesisestus, vormindamine ja kinnitamine, lihtsustades töövooge ja tagades järjepidevuse ning täpsuse.

Kuidas dokumendiautomaatika töövooge parandab?

Dokumendiautomaatika kiirendab korduvaid protsesse, vähendab vigu ja tagab vastavuse, standardiseerides dokumentide loomist. Samuti integreerub see olemasolevate süsteemidega, nagu CRM-id ja ERP-id, sujuva andmevoo tagamiseks, suurendades üldist efektiivsust.

Millised ettevõtted saavad dokumendiautomaatikast kõige rohkem kasu?

Dokumendiautomaatikast saavad kasu kõik ettevõtted, kes käsitlevad suures mahus dokumente, eriti järgmised tööstusharud:

     
  • Juriidika: lepingute ja kokkulepete jaoks.
    •  
  • Rahandus: arvete ja vastavusdokumentide jaoks.
    •  
  • Müük: ettepanekute ja hinnapakkumiste jaoks.
    •  
  • HR: töötajate lepingute ja sisseelamisdokumentide jaoks.

Millised on dokumendiautomaatika tarkvara peamised funktsioonid?

Mõned olulised funktsioonid hõlmavad:

     
  • Massdokumentide loomist.
    •  
  • Integratsioon olemasolevate süsteemidega.
    •  
  • E-allkirja võimalusi.
    •  
  • Kohandatavaid malle.
    •  
  • Tööstusharu regulatsioonide järgimist.

Kas dokumendiautomaatika on turvaline?

Jah, enamik kaasaegseid dokumendiautomaatika tööriistu sisaldab täiustatud turvameetmeid nagu krüpteerimine, rollipõhine juurdepääsukontroll ja auditeerimisjäljed, et tagada andmete kaitse ja vastavus regulatiivsetele nõuetele.

Milline on dokumendiautomaatika tööriista hind?

Hinnad varieeruvad sõltuvalt funktsioonidest, kasutajate arvust ja kasutusmahust. Mõned tööriistad pakuvad tellimuspõhist hinnastamist, samas kui teised pakuvad kohandatud plaane vastavalt ärivajadustele. Paljud platvormid pakuvad ka tasuta prooviversioone või demosid.

Name: Tips for effective contract review
Meta Title: Tips for Effective Contract Review
Meta Description: Learn the essential tips for an effective contract review process. Find out how to properly review contracts and what to look for to ensure a successful review.
Keyword: contract, review, tips, successful, process
Post Summary: In this article we'll share some tips for ensuring that contracts are effectively reviewed and approved during the contract lifecycle management (CLM) process and places where Agrello can be of help.
Post Body:
Importance of review and approval

The third step of Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is contract review and approval. Contracts are critical to any business because they set the terms of agreements between parties and define the duties obligations and responsibilities of each party. Therefore, it's important that contracts are properly reviewed and approved to ensure that they accurately reflect the terms that were agreed upon and comply with other legal requirements.

By ensuring all parties agree to the terms of the contract and it meets their expectations, the review and approval phase reduces the risk of disputes and litigation. It also helps avoid contract violations, missed deadlines, and other problems that can arise from poorly written or unclear contracts.

Tips for effective review and approval process

Here are some tips for ensuring that contracts are effectively reviewed and approved during the contract lifecycle management process and places where Agrello can lend you a hand.

📌 Define roles and responsibilities

It's important to define the roles and responsibilities for reviewing and approving contracts. This includes identifying who will be responsible for reviewing and approving the contract and who needs to provide advice and guidance as a legal or compliance expert. If the contracts are standard contracts, the contract template review can be completed at an earlier stage when the contract text is prepared and agreed upon and the assistance of lawyers or paralegals is required. Subsequently, the agreed template can be uploaded to Agrello and used over and over again without further help from lawyers.

📝 Establish standard procedures

Establish standard procedures for reviewing and approving contracts. This includes defining the steps involved in the review process and setting a timeline for completing each step. It's also important to establish a clear process for documenting and tracking contract changes.

👮 Ensure compliance with regulations and policies

Make sure contracts comply with all relevant regulations, policies, and legal requirements. This includes ensuring that the contract meets all applicable industry standards and adheres to any specific regulatory requirements.

📢 Communicate effectively

Effective communication is essential throughout the contract lifecycle, including the review and approval phase. Keeping all parties involved in the contract informed of the review process and the expected timeline for completion is essential. It's also important to establish clear communication channels to address questions or concerns that may arise during the review. To avoid emailing the document back and forth via email, Agrello allows you to assign fields for your counterparty to fill in. This way, all relevant information and details can be entered directly into the contract text, and no one can sign until all fields are filled in. Before signing, all parties can review the data entered.

💻 Use technology to streamline the process

Use technology to streamline the review and approval process. Contract management softwares can automate the review and approval process, providing an efficient and streamlined approach to managing the contract lifecycle. This includes automated workflows, digital signatures and other tools that help eliminate errors and increase efficiency. With Agrello, the process takes place in a single environment, which helps you continuously track the document's progress and avoid it getting stuck in someone's mailbox.

Conclusion

The review and approval phase of contract lifecycle management is an important part of the CLM process that ensures contracts are accurate, complete, and legally binding. By establishing roles and responsibilities, implementing standard procedures, ensuring compliance, communicating effectively, and using technology to streamline the process, organisations can ensure that contracts are effectively reviewed and approved. Effective contract management can help organisations reduce the risk of disputes, improve compliance, and ensure that contracts meet the needs and expectations of all parties involved.

Name: Töö- ja maksuõiguse muudatused 2026: kuidas valmistuda?
Meta Title: Töö- ja maksuõiguse muudatused 2026: kuidas valmistuda?
Meta Description: Töö- ja maksuõiguse muudatused 2026 mõjutavad tööandjate lepinguhaldust ja maksuvaba tulu arvestust. Vaata, kuidas Agrello aitab muudatustega toime tulla.
Keyword: töö- ja maksuõiguse muudatused 2026, maksuvaba tulu 2026, paindlik tööaeg, töölepingud 2026, lepinguhaldus, HR tööriistad, Agrello dokumendihaldus
Post Summary: 2026. aasta toob kaks muudatust, mis mõjutavad otseselt iga tööandja palgaarvestust ja lepinguhaldust. Ühtne maksuvaba tulu muudab küll maksuarvestuse loogika selgemaks, kuid eeldab HR-tiimilt maksuvaba tulu avalduste süstemaatilist kogumist ja uuendamist. Samal ajal lubab töölepinguseaduse muudatus sõlmida paindliku tööajaga lepinguid kõigis sektorites, mis tähendab, et lepingutes tuleb täpsemalt sõnastada töötundide miinimum, lisatundide vahemik ja tööaja planeerimise kord.
Post Body:
Mõlemad muudatused suurendavad lepingute ja avalduste mahtu ning nõuavad, et ettevõttel oleks ülevaade sellest, millised dokumendid kehtivad ja millal need allkirjastati. Kui seni võisid organisatsioonid kasutada eri vorme ja improvisatsiooni, siis 2026. aastal on vaja selgelt struktureeritud ja kergesti hallatavat lepingupõhist töökorraldust. Just siin muutub dokumendihalduse kvaliteet sisuliseks konkurentsieeliseks: korrektsed mallid, läbipaistev versioonihaldus ja ühtne allkirjastamisprotsess vähendavad riske ning säästavad HR-tiimi aega.

‍

‍

Maksuvaba tulu reform: lihtsam süsteem, suurem dokumenteerimise vajadus

Alates 2026. aastast kehtib kõigile tööealistele ühtne 700-eurone maksuvaba tulu. Selle muudatuse eesmärk on kaotada keeruline maksuküür ning muuta palga kujunemine töötajatele paremini mõistetavaks. HR-i jaoks tähendab see aga ennekõike dokumentatsiooni ajakohastamist: töötajad peavad esitama maksuvaba tulu avalduse tööandjale ning paljud senised avaldused vajavad uuendamist, sest nendele on märgitud varasem summa või nad ei vasta uuele sõnastusele.

Kuna maksuvaba tulu saab rakendada ainult üks tööandja, peab HR täpselt arvestama, kes on esitanud avalduse, mis summas ning millal see kehtima hakkas. Lisaks tuleb üleminekuperioodil selgitada töötajatele, miks detsembris tehtud töö eest jaanuaris makstav palk kuulub juba uue süsteemi alla. Ilma selge dokumentatsioonita võib ainuüksi üks puuduv või valesti esitatud avaldus tekitada arusaamatusi töötasu suuruse ja tulumaksu kinnipidamise osas.

Seetõttu muutub maksuvaba tulu avalduste süstemaatiline kogumine ja säilitamine HR-i töös 2026. aastal vältimatuks. Organisatsioonidel, kus töötajaid on kümneid või rohkem, ei ole mõistlik tugineda e-kirjadele või käsitsi hallatavatele tabelitele. 

Vajalik on selgelt hallatud protsess, mille korral kõik avaldused on ühes kohas, ajaliselt jälgitavad ja vajadusel kiiresti uuendatavad. 

Paindliku tööaja kokkulepped: uus võimalus kõigile sektoritele

Peagi jõustuv töölepinguseaduse muudatus lubab ettevõtetel sõlmida paindliku tööajaga lepinguid kõigi töötajatega, mitte enam ainult valitud sihtrühmadega. Praktikas tähendab see, et töötajal võib olla lepingus fikseeritud minimaalne tööaeg nädalas, kuid tegelik koormus võib periooditi ulatuda täistööajani. Selline lahendus sobib organisatsioonidele, kus töömaht kõikub, kuid eeldab lepingutes tavapärasest täpsemaid kokkuleppeid tööaja ülesehituse kohta.

Personaliosakonna jaoks tähendab see muudatus, et töölepingud ei saa olla enam ühe lausega kirjeldatud koormuse määrangud. Lepingus tuleb selgelt sõnastada miinimumkoormus, lisatundide lubatud piirid ning see, kuidas töötajale teatatakse tööajakava muutustest. Samuti tuleb vältida olukorda, kus töötaja jääb õiguslikult ebaselgesse “valvel olekusse”: paindlik töökorraldus ei tohi tähendada pidevat kättesaadavuse ootust ilma vastava kokkuleppeta.

See nõuab personaliosakonnalt täpsust ka protsesside tasandil. Kui osal töötajatel on tavaline osakoormus ja teistel paindlik tööaeg, peab organisatsioon suutma eristada lepingutüüpe, hallata nende versioone ja tagada, et iga töötaja saab just talle kohandatud lepingu. 

Kuidas Agrello aitab 2026. aasta muudatustega toime tulla

Kõik need eelmainitud muudatused nõuavad personaliosakonnalt selget ülevaadet nii töölepingute sisust kui ka maksuvaba tulu avalduste seisust. Agrello aitab seda kõike hallata viisil, mis vähendab käsitööd ja välistab dokumendikaose tekkimist.

Agrello lepingumallid ja masskoostamise tööriistad võimaldavad kiiresti luua tüüpilise paindliku tööaja lepingu kõigile töötajatele, hoida korraga kontrolli sadade lepingute ja nende versioonide üle ning tagada, et dokumendid vastavad kehtivale seadusandlusele. Sama loogika lihtsustab ka maksuvaba tulu avalduste kogumist: ühtne protsess loob selguse ja vähendab eksimisriski.

Lisaks saab Agrellos luua avalikult jagatud lepingumalli, mida ei pea töötajatele individuaalselt saatma. Piisab lingi jagamisest ettevõtte Teamsi kanalisse või siseveebi: iga töötaja saab sealt avada enda versiooni, täita nõutud väljad ja allkirjastada lepingu iseseisvalt. See muudab massallkirjastamise kiireks ega nõua HR-tiimilt täiendavaid samme.

Kui soovite, saame koos vaadata, kuidas Agrello saaks teie ettevõttes töölepingu halduse viia uuele tasemele — paindlikult, korrastatult ja skaleeritult.

‍

Näide: Kuidas ettevõte võiks valmistuda 2026. aastaks

Ettevõte, kus töötab umbes 80 inimest, peab 2026. aasta alguseks korrastama nii maksuvaba tulu avaldused kui ka uued paindliku tööaja lepingud. Kõige selgem on alustada konkreetsete sammudega, mis vähendavad personaliosakonna koormust ja loovad ühtse protsessi.‍

1. samm: Valmista lepingupõhjad ette

Personaliosakond koostab ajakohastatud maksuvaba tulu avalduse ja paindliku tööaja lepingu mallid, mis vastavad 2026. aasta nõuetele ning kirjeldavad selgelt koormuse ja lisatundide loogikat.

2. samm: Tee Agrellos avalikult jagatavad mallid

mõlemast dokumendist luuakse Agrellos avalikult jagatud lepingumall, mille link jagatakse töötajatele sisekanali kaudu. Töötaja saab lingile klõpsates avada, täita ja allkirjastada enda versiooni ilma individuaalse kutseta.

‍3. samm: Loo lepingud hulgi

Vajadusel kasutatakse masskoostamise tööriista, et korraga teha muudatusi kogu töötajaskonna lepingutes või avaldustes; nii püsivad dokumendid ühtse sisuga ja allkirjastamisprotsess kontrollitav.

Nende sammude tulemusel on personaliosakonnal selge ülevaade kõigist allkirjastatud dokumentidest ning muudatuste rakendamine ei nõua käsitsi koordineerimist iga töötajaga eraldi.

Paindlikkus toimib ainult siis, kui dokumendid on korras

2026. aasta muudatused teevad töökorralduse paindlikumaks ja maksusüsteemi selgemaks, kuid eeldavad, et personaliosakond suudab hallata suure hulga dokumente ühtsete reeglite järgi. Ühtne maksuvaba tulu nõuab ajakohaseid avaldusi ning paindliku tööaja kasutuselevõtt nõuab täpselt sõnastatud lepinguid. Kui need kaks protsessi on korrastamata, tekivad kiiresti olukorrad, kus töötasu arvutamine või töökoormuse planeerimine tugineb puudulikule infole.

Agrello aitab vältida seda killustatust. Ühtsed mallid, masskoostamine ja avalikult jagatud lepingumallid loovad viisi, kuidas HR-tiim saab suuri muudatusi rakendada korraga kogu organisatsioonis. Nii saab ettevõte keskenduda töökorralduse tegelikule parendamisele, mitte dokumentide haldamisele.

‍

Võta meiega ühendust ja uuri, kuidas saaksime ka teil aidata säästa tunde lepingute uuendamisel.

‍

Korduma Kippuvad Küsimused

Kuidas mõjutavad 2026. aasta töö- ja maksuõiguse muudatused tööandjaid?

Muudatused tähendavad suuremat dokumenteerimise vajadust: maksuvaba tulu avaldusi tuleb süstemaatiliselt koguda ning töölepingud peavad kajastama paindlikku tööaja loogikat.

Mis on uus maksuvaba tulu määr alates 2026. aastast?

Alates 2026. aastast kehtib kõigile tööealistele ühtne maksuvaba tulu määr 700 eurot kuus, mis asendab varasema astmelise süsteemi.

Mida tähendab paindliku tööajaga leping tööandja jaoks?

See tähendab, et lepingutes tuleb fikseerida miinimumtööaeg, lisatundide vahemik ja tööaja planeerimise kord. Lepingute haldus muutub mahukamaks ja detailsemaks.

Kuidas Agrello saab aidata nende muudatuste haldamisel?

Agrello võimaldab luua ja jagada ajakohaseid lepingumalle, koguda maksuvaba tulu avaldusi ning hallata versioone ja allkirjastamist süsteemselt ja kiiresti.

Kas Agrellot saab kasutada massallkirjastamiseks?

Jah, Agrello masskoostamise ja -allkirjastamise tööriistad võimaldavad hallata korraga kogu töötajaskonna dokumente.

Miks ei sobi enam e-kirjad ja Exceli tabelid HR-dokumentide haldamiseks?

Suurenenud dokumendimaht ja õiguslikud nõuded nõuavad selget protsessi, milles kõik avaldused ja lepingud on ajaliselt jälgitavad ja turvaliselt hallatud.
